EntranceChild.synopsis: One-liner dialog for a children boy who stands with his father next to the entrance of the circus.
EntranceChild.how_to_trigger: Debug book, act 3, wyrm's crossing, circus of the last days. He's just outside the entrance with his dad, Emmet.

AD_Clown_Combat_02.synopsis: Combat AD for the Doppelganger Clown to yell when their turn starts.
AD_Clown_Combat_02.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Circus, start the fight with the clown

AD_Ringmaster.synopsis: Repeated AD for the ringmaster necromancer.

FlamingFist_01.synopsis: Short dialog for the fallback flaming fist officer who appears out of offstage if the players left the combat with Dribbles and took a Long Rest, but Ringmaster has died. The players then can ask what has happened.
FlamingFist_01.how_to_trigger: * BGO_Main_A, Circus -49; 43; -40- Start combat with Dribbles- Make sure Ringmaster dies (via ctrl+K or whatever)- Leave combat and long rest- Return back to the circus -49; 43; -40

SculptorAssistant.synopsis: Stoney is an earth elemental who speaks with the sound of earth moving and rock falling - the language terran. She works making sculptures in the circus.
SculptorAssistant.how_to_trigger: Debug book book, act 3, wyrm's crossing, circus of the last days. Go through the gate and directly ahead of you in the corner is stoney a- near the sculptures.

ScaredChild.synopsis: Dialog for the scared girl with her mother watching furious beasts in the cages.
ScaredChild.how_to_trigger: Debug Book > Act 3 > Wyrm's Crossing > Circus of the Last Days. The kid and her mom are by the caged animals near Dribbles.

Patron_01.synopsis: One-liner dialog for one of the crowd patrons in the crowd at Dribbles' show.
Patron_01.how_to_trigger: Debug Book > Act 3 > Wyrm's Crossing > Circus of the Last Days. Go through the circus and to the right - trigger the Dribbles fight (1,1,1,1 the scene). You can speak to this chatacter after.

EntranceGuard.synopsis: One-liner dialog for a circus worker on the checkpoint after the player is allowed to enter. He has a friendly circus ghoul with him to check on the entering customers.
EntranceGuard.how_to_trigger: Use the debug book to got to Act 3 > Wyrm's Crossing > Circus of the Last Days. You will be teleported to directly outside the circus gates - click on the ghoul or the man next to him to start the checkpoint, then speak to this character afterwards to get these lines.

AD_EntranceChildAndParent.synopsis: Father and his son stay near the circus entrance, and are about to enter. However the kid is a bit scared of the ghoul there.

PAD_ItemFake.synopsis: Played when a character tries to click on a fake item behind the djinni in the circus. Player has to sneak in and look at them, and realises all the 'fabulous' prizes are nothing but junk.
PAD_ItemFake.how_to_trigger: Sneak and click on the 'prizes' behind akabi in the circus.

AD_Patron_01_Help.synopsis: An one-shot AD that one of the patrons plays during the combat with fake Dribbles the Clown. The character cries for help.
AD_Patron_01_Help.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Circus. Start the combat with the clown, the AD will be played on the player's turn in combat.

AD_Merchant.synopsis: Repeated AD for a shady circus merchant attracting the customers.

PAD_CircusDisappeared.synopsis: This PAD is played when the player returns to the circus, but it's gone. It could be expected - because the player had completed the Dribbles quest, or if the Rinmaster was killed, so the phrase and emotion should stay vague.
PAD_CircusDisappeared.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A,Make circus disappear:a) complete Dribbles quest,b) kill Ringmaster and long rest,c) start combat with the clown, leave it and long restd) oe WYR_Circus_TestDisappearReturn.

Merchant.synopsis: Dialog for the circus kobold merchant, who sells weird magical items and shady stuff. He feels like the shady drug dealer on the corner who is high on his own merchandise. In this dialogue, after the dribbles fight, you can also buy dribble's hand off him (for a ridiculously high price.)
Merchant.how_to_trigger: Debug book, act 3, wyrm's crossing, circus of the last days. Go through the checkpoint, and popper is straight ahead and slightly to the right (he's next to stoney and boney, the married couple selling statues). To trigger the options to buy Dribbles' hand, go to the circus stage, 1,1,1, the dialogue, use killcombat, and then go back to popper. You can speak to him and notice he had dribbles hand, or you can even grab it from the chair next to him (which will automatically trigger a dialogue).

PAD_KarlachCantEnterCircus.synopsis: Karlach is in the party and players fail to get into the circus after trying to persuade Klaus.
PAD_KarlachCantEnterCircus.how_to_trigger: 1. Load BGO_Main_A.2. Have companion Karlach in your party.3. goto -18; 48; -774. Speak with Klaus and fail ability checks to enter the circus.

FortuneWheelWorker.synopsis: Dialog for the wheel of fortune mini-game operated by Akabi - the djinni, destroyer of the worlds. Players can win random magical items with side effects or try to uncover the cheating djinni performs and win a grind prize, upsetting him (which results in you being sent to a jungle to be eaten by dinosaurs).
FortuneWheelWorker.how_to_trigger: Debug book, act 3, wyrm's crossing, circus of the last days. Go through the checkpoint, and akabis is straight ahead of you. He's the blue Djinni with the wheel next to him.

FacePainter.synopsis: Dialogue for Zara the Mummy. She is heavily wrapped in bandages.
FacePainter.how_to_trigger: Debug book, act 3, wyrm's crossing, circus of the last days. USE CNTRL + T to teleport past the checkpoint in front of you, and she's just past the entrance.

PAD_FoundClownCorpse.synopsis: An automated dialog that will be called each time the party picks up a piece of Dribbles. They comment on what they find and also how much they have left to gather.
PAD_FoundClownCorpse.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_ATriggered each time the player finds a piece of Dribbles the Clown’s corpse.

Patron_04.synopsis: One-liner dialog for one of the crowd patrons in the crowd at Dribbles' show.
Patron_04.how_to_trigger: Debug Book > Act 3 > Wyrm's Crossing > Circus of the Last Days. Go through the circus and to the right - trigger the Dribbles fight (1,1,1,1 the scene). You can speak to this chatacter after.

Ringmaster.synopsis: Main dialog for the ringmaster - a necromancer lady and the owner of the circus. She has her own tent where she trains dancing skeleton troupe, but after combat with Dribbles she runs to the combat scene and will ask player some questions.
Ringmaster.how_to_trigger: Bottom branch - simply approach her and speak to her.Middle branch - approach the stage with dribbles, 1,1,1 through the dialogue, do killcombat in recon. Lucretious will walk towards the stage, and you can get the Dribbles quest then.Top branches - accept the quest/finish the quest.

Clown_PreShow_Companions.synopsis: Companion going on the stage branch of the WYR_Circus_Clown_PreShow dialog, which was cut to this separate dialog for the better cine maintenance. After the player picks a companion in the original dialog this one starts, where we see companion climbing on the stage and after a short line from Dribbles his beast attacks the character.
Clown_PreShow_Companions.how_to_trigger: Complete WYR_Circus_Clown_PreShow and elect for a companion to go on stage

ScaredChildMother.synopsis: One-liner dialog for the mother of a scared child, standing next to the circus beasts cages. The beasts are quite scary.
ScaredChildMother.how_to_trigger: Debug Book > Act 3 > Wyrm's Crossing > Circus of the Last Days. The kid and her mom are by the caged animals near dribbles.

AD_SculptorAndAssistant.synopsis: Stoney and Boney (earth elemental and mud mephit) are chatting about current orders, and checking in on each other's days. Stoney speaks with the sound of earth moving and rock falling - the language terran.
AD_SculptorAndAssistant.how_to_trigger: Debug book book, act 3, wyrm's crossing, circus of the last days. Go through the gate and directly ahead of you in the corner is stoney and boney - near the sculptures.

Patron_05.synopsis: One-liner dialog for one of the crowd patrons in the crowd at Dribbles' show.
Patron_05.how_to_trigger: Debug Book > Act 3 > Wyrm's Crossing > Circus of the Last Days. Go through the circus and to the right - trigger the Dribbles fight (1,1,1,1 the scene). You can speak to this chatacter after.

PAD_ReturnedFromJungle.synopsis: This PAD is played when the player character finally returns from the jungle after being teleported there by the circus djinni.
PAD_ReturnedFromJungle.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A,oe WYR_Circus_TestJungle,ctrl+T to the portal and click on it to get back.

Korrilla.synopsis: This is a fallback one-liner. In case the Player manages to approach her an initiate dialog in the Circus in Wyrm's crossing. Korrilla gives a cryptic one-liner to the player. No Hasmet node is needed, as she teleports away right after.
Korrilla.how_to_trigger: Go to -81; 45; -35 in BGO_Main_A.Open ReCon and use "statusapply INVISIBILITY"approach Korrilla (located at -91; 45; -28) and click on her to initiate dialog.

AD_Patron_05_Help.synopsis: An one-shot AD that one of the patrons plays during the combat with fake Dribbles the Clown. The character cries for help.
AD_Patron_05_Help.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Circus. Start the combat with the clown, the AD will be played on the player's turn in combat.

AD_Clown_Combat_01.synopsis: Combat AD for the Doppelganger Clown to yell when their turn starts.
AD_Clown_Combat_01.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Circus, start the fight with the clown

AD_FortuneWheelWorker.synopsis: Repeated AD for the powerful djinni - who's bound to the Wheel of Fortune in the Circus. He hates his job and wants to be free, but still somewhat forced to entertain and attract the customers.

GhoulSniffer.synopsis: One-liner dialog for a circus ghoul, who sniffs customers entering the circus.
GhoulSniffer.how_to_trigger: Use the debug book to got to act 3, wyrm's crossing, Circus of the Last Days. You will be teleported to directly outside the circus gates - click on the ghoul or the man next to get the checkpoint dialogue. After that, you can get these one-liners.

Clown_Dead.synopsis: The SwD dialog for the doppelganger who has shape-changed to look like a beloved Dribbles the Clown. While dead, the doppelganger is in his real form though.
Clown_Dead.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, CircusKill fake Dribbles, SwD on them.

DancingSkeletons.synopsis: A one-liner narrator dialog for all dancing skeletons in the circus.
DancingSkeletons.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Circus-82; 45; -31, talk to any of the skeletons.

EntranceCivilian.synopsis: One-liner dialog for a citizen who just entered the circus. He is the civilian who is being sniffed by the ghoul as you enter the checkpoint scene.
EntranceCivilian.how_to_trigger: Debug book > Act 3 > Wyrm's Crossing > Circus of the Last Days. Do the checkpoint scene and you can then get this civilian's one-liners.

BackupPerformer_01.synopsis: A one-liner dialog for the fire-breathing circus performer lady.

PAD_EnteredJungle.synopsis: A PAD that a party character plays when is being teleported to a jungle by a djinni, who the character have cought on cheating. The character sees the dinosaurs and realises that they are in danger and need to proceed with caution.Side note: the characters in BG3 might not know these reptilian creatures called "dinosaurs".

PAD_FakeTreasurePile.synopsis: Played when a character tries to click on a treasure pile in the djinni's "wheel of fortune" booth.
PAD_FakeTreasurePile.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Circus, -68; 47; -78Click on the treasure pile.

BackupBard_02.synopsis: A one-liner dialog for the backup bard in the circus playing a lyre. The actor does not need to be playing a lyre as this dialogue 'interrupts' his performance.

AD_LoveDryad.synopsis: Repeated AD for a female Dryad who offers for a price to test your bond with one of the player's companions. She attracts the customers there.

BackupBard_01.synopsis: A one-liner dialog for the backup bard in the circus playing a drum next to another brad. Actor does not need to mimic playing a drum - the dialogue 'interrupts' their performance.

AD_Clown_Combat_03.synopsis: Combat AD for the Doppelganger Clown to yell when their turn starts.
AD_Clown_Combat_03.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Circus, start the fight with the clown

AD_ScaredChildAndMother.synopsis: Mother and her daughter stay near the circus beasts cages, watching the furious animals inside.

EntranceChildParent.synopsis: One-liner dialog for a male citizen who stands with his unsure child right next to the circus entrance.
EntranceChildParent.how_to_trigger: Debug book, act 3, wyrm's crossing, circus of the last days. He's just outside the checkpoint with his son.

Clown.synopsis: Main dialogue for the Dribbles the Clown, who in reality is a disguised doppelganger serving the Bhaalists. The player may trigger it by using stealth and approaching the stage from behind.
Clown.how_to_trigger: Debug book > Act 3 > Wyrm's Crossing > Circus of the Last Days. Go to the back of the circus to Dribbles' stage and sneak up on him and speak to him.

Patron_02.synopsis: One-liner dialog for one of the crowd patrons in the crowd at Dribbles' show.
Patron_02.how_to_trigger: Debug Book > Act 3 > Wyrm's Crossing > Circus of the Last Days. Go through the circus and to the right - trigger the Dribbles fight (1,1,1,1 the scene). You can speak to this chatacter after.

Clown_PreShow.synopsis: Dribbles the clown (actually a doppelganger who stole the identity of the famous clown) is on a stage with Buddy the dog beside him. A large crowd looks on. In this scene, Dribbles invites the player on the stage. Player can 1) approach the stage 2) tell a companion to get up on stage or 3) refuse - in which case a fan will volunteer. At the end of the scene, Buddy the dog attempts to sneak up on whoever is on stage and attacks.
Clown_PreShow.how_to_trigger: Load act 3, BGO_Main_A, Circus of the last days. Walk through the checkpoint, and circle around the back of the circus. There will be a large crowd in front of a stage. Approach and the scene will trigger automatically.

DressingRoomSleeper.synopsis: A one-liner dialog with a circus worker in the dressing room. He initially sleeping, but will wake up if combat starts.
DressingRoomSleeper.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Circustalk to a sleeping character at -27; 45; -47

AD_Patron_02_Help.synopsis: An one-shot AD that one of the patrons plays during the combat with fake Dribbles the Clown. The character cries for help.
AD_Patron_02_Help.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Circus. Start the combat with the clown, the AD will be played on the player's turn in combat.

Thug_01.synopsis: Dialog with the thug - Dribbles-doppelganger associate. Stands near the animal cages. She's mean and eager for violence.
Thug_01.how_to_trigger: Debug Book, Act 3, Wyrm's Crossing, Circus of the Last Days. Move through the circus to the right, towards Dribbles' stage. You'll see this character next to the dinosaur Crimson's cage.

AD_Poster.synopsis: This AD is played when the player clicks on the circus advertising dummy, before noticing that there's something inside - so just reading the advertising written on it.

CuriousFan.synopsis: One-liner dialog for the fan in the crowd at Dribbles' show.
CuriousFan.how_to_trigger: Debug Book > Act 3 > Wyrm's Crossing > Circus of the Last Days. Go through the circus and to the right - trigger the Dribbles fight (1,1,1,1 the scene). You can speak to this chatacter after.

AD_Clown_Attack.synopsis: An one-shot AD that fake Dribbles the Clown yells to the player when a combat with him starts.
AD_Clown_Attack.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Circus. Approach the scene and attack the clown.

Thug_02.synopsis: Dialog with the thug - Dribbles-doppelganger associate. Stands near the animal cages. Probably just a one-liner.
Thug_02.how_to_trigger: Debug book, act 3, wyrm's crossing, circus of the last days. One of the thugs standing near the animal cages by dribbles' stage.

PAD_PostCombat.synopsis: A PAD that plays after the combat with the doppelganger clown concludes, The party (preferable - a companion) comments on the clown being actually a shapeshifter/on the fact that a monster just tried to kill them at the circus.
PAD_PostCombat.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, CircusAttack and kill the clown, end the battle.

FlamingFist_02.synopsis: One-liner dialog for the fallback flaming fist officer who appears out of offstage if the players left the combat with Dribbles, and if Ringmaster has died.
FlamingFist_02.how_to_trigger: * BGO_Main_A, Circus -49; 43; -40- Start combat with Dribbles- Make sure Ringmaster dies (via ctrl+K or whatever)- Leave combat and long rest- Return back to the circus -49; 43; -40

Beast_02.synopsis: Crimson the dinosaur is one of the animals who will participate in the doppelganger-dribbles attack. Player can examine him and realise Crimson isn't angry, he's starving. If the player feeds him some meat, he is so busy eating during the attack that he doesn't participate.In the bottom branch, he's so hungry that he's on the brink of losing his mind - he's snapping, furious, and all he craves is meat.
Beast_02.how_to_trigger: Load Act 3. Teleport to the circus. Shadow and Crimson are currently by Dribbles and in seperate cages. Feed Crimson and trap Shadow before triggering the fight in order for them to survive and have subsequent dialogues after the fight.

DressingRoomWorker.synopsis: A one-liner dialog with a circus worker in the dressing room. She watches Dribbles performing on the stage.
DressingRoomWorker.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Circustalk to the performer lady at -30; 45; -40

Bard.synopsis: A one-liner dialog for the bard in the circus playing a flute for the crowd there. Actor does not need to mimic playing the flute - the dialogue 'interrupts' their performance.
Bard.how_to_trigger: Load act three, use the debug book to teleport to the Last Days Circus. Violet is performing on the circus grounds, surrounded by a crowd of people.

BackupPerformer_02.synopsis: A one-liner dialog for the juggling circus performer.

RedcapCleaner_001.synopsis: A one-liner dialog for a redcap who works as a cleaner in the circus. There are a total of two of them.
RedcapCleaner_001.how_to_trigger: Debug book, act 3, wrym's crossing, circus of the last days. You'll find the redcaps wandering around the circus.

LoveDryad.synopsis: The dryad from the circus of the last days is mastering a "Test your love" game, where player can ask a companion to participate and answer some questions about them for the approval rating.
LoveDryad.how_to_trigger: Debug book, act 3, wyrm's crossing, circus of the last days. Go through the checkpoint, and Zethino is the dryad off to the right.

Beast_01.synopsis: Shadow the displacer beast is one of the animals who will participate in the doppelganger-dribbles attack. Player can try (and fail) to calm her, and realise the only way to stop her is to break the cage lock and trap her.
Beast_01.how_to_trigger: Load act 3. Teleport to the circus. Shadow and Crimson are currently by Dribbles and in seperate cages. Feed Crimson and trap Shadow before triggering the fight in order for them to survive and have subsequent dialogues after the fight.

Checkpoint.synopsis: The dialog on the entrance to the extraplanar circus, where the player sees a ghoul sniffing entering customers - new measures because of the recent murders nearby. The player can pay an entrance fee and go and see the circus.
Checkpoint.how_to_trigger: Use the debug book to got to act 3, wyrm's crossing, Circus of the Last Days. You will be teleported to directly outside the circus gates - click on the ghoul or the man next to him to start this dialogue.

Bouncer.synopsis: A bugbear guards an off-limits area of the circus. Grumpy.
Bouncer.how_to_trigger: Debug book, act 3, wyrm's crossing, circus of the last days. Fyodor is through the checkpoint and directly to your right, about halfway through the circus up near the outer wall.

RedcapCleaner_002.synopsis: A one-liner dialog for a redcap who works as a cleaner in the circus. There are a total of two of them.
RedcapCleaner_002.how_to_trigger: Debug book, act 3, wyrm's crossing, circus of the last days. You'll find the redcaps grumpily patrolling the circus.

AD_Patron_04_Help.synopsis: An one-shot AD that one of the patrons plays during the combat with fake Dribbles the Clown. The character cries for help.
AD_Patron_04_Help.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A, Circus. Start the combat with the clown, the AD will be played on the player's turn in combat.

Sculptor.synopsis: A mud mephit called Boney who works with his earth elemental wife Stoney to sell statues in the circus.
Sculptor.how_to_trigger: Debug Book > Act 3 > Wyrm's Crossing > Circus of the Last Days. Stoney and Boney are through the checkpoint, in the far left corner, with a bunch of statues around them.

EntranceChild_0.speaker: Gable
EntranceChild_0.text: Dad said the screams inside were part of the show, but they weren't, right? I bet they weren't.

EntranceChild_1.speaker: Gable
EntranceChild_1.text: The monster thing is scary. Will you go first? Thanks.

EntranceChild_2.speaker: Gable
EntranceChild_2.text: I want to see Dribbles, but I don't like the monster at the door...

AD_Clown_Combat_02_0.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
AD_Clown_Combat_02_0.context: NodeContext: Battlecry on his turn. Deranged, excited

AD_Ringmaster_0.speaker: Lucretious
AD_Ringmaster_0.text: Dribbles, I am going to give you a majestic new body! Maybe a tail?

AD_Ringmaster_1.speaker: Lucretious
AD_Ringmaster_1.text: Coming to this plane was a mistake.

AD_Ringmaster_2.speaker: Lucretious
AD_Ringmaster_2.text: Dribbles, why did you have to go missing now, of all times?

AD_Ringmaster_3.speaker: Lucretious
AD_Ringmaster_3.text: Move it, people - I want us gone yesterday!

AD_Ringmaster_4.speaker: Lucretious
AD_Ringmaster_4.text: Get it right this time, or I'll resurrect someone who can!

AD_Ringmaster_5.speaker: Lucretious
AD_Ringmaster_5.text: Leave nothing behind - the Hells will freeze before we return to this dump.

AD_Ringmaster_6.speaker: Lucretious
AD_Ringmaster_6.text: That's it, make love to the air, skellies!

AD_Ringmaster_7.speaker: Lucretious
AD_Ringmaster_7.text: My skellies will take forever to clean this place up...

AD_Ringmaster_8.speaker: Lucretious
AD_Ringmaster_8.text: You call that a posé?! Again! AGAIN.

FlamingFist_01_1.speaker: Fist Taraji
FlamingFist_01_1.text: Back up, this is a crime scene.

FlamingFist_01_2.speaker: Fist Taraji
FlamingFist_01_2.text: The cult of the Absolute - what else? They turned this place into a bloodbath.
FlamingFist_01_2.context: NodeContext: not remotely bothered by this

FlamingFist_01_6.speaker: Fist Taraji
FlamingFist_01_6.text: The ringmaster of the whole operation. Cultist gutted her.
FlamingFist_01_6.context: NodeContext: not remotely bothered by this

FlamingFist_01_3.speaker: Fist Taraji
FlamingFist_01_3.text: We haven't caught the killer yet, but we will. Now, be on your way.
FlamingFist_01_3.context: NodeContext: clearly has no intention of pursuing the criminal - just assumes they've gone

FlamingFist_01_7.speaker: Fist Taraji
FlamingFist_01_7.text: You've seen enough - move along now.

SculptorAssistant_0.speaker: Stoney
SculptorAssistant_0.context: NodeContext: rumbling sound of earth moving - she's shy and doesn't know what to say to the player

SculptorAssistant_1.speaker: Stoney
SculptorAssistant_1.context: NodeContext: sound of earth moving - reassuing and gentle and then a sudden crack of something falling - like she was musing to herself and the player surprised her

ScaredChild_0.speaker: Becca
ScaredChild_0.text: Dribbles is supposed to be nice - why did he do that? I don't like this. I don't like him.
ScaredChild_0.context: NodeContext: scared and a little upset

ScaredChild_1.speaker: Becca
ScaredChild_1.text: Mum said Crimson the dilophosaurus looks sick, but I think he's fine.

ScaredChild_2.speaker: Becca
ScaredChild_2.text: Mum won't let me touch the animals. Bet you don't have to ask your mum to pet a stupid cat.

ScaredChild_3.speaker: Becca
ScaredChild_3.text: I want to go home - right now.
ScaredChild_3.context: NodeContext: scared and a little upset

Patron_01_0.speaker: Flimsy
Patron_01_0.text: Dribbles! He can't be dead! He can't.

Patron_01_1.speaker: Flimsy
Patron_01_1.text: This - this must be part of the show. Dribbles is going to pop up at any moment - you'll see.

Patron_01_2.speaker: Flimsy
Patron_01_2.text: This wasn't in the last show!

EntranceGuard_0.speaker: Klaus
EntranceGuard_0.text: I heard what you did - about Dribbles. He is... was, a good egg. Thank you, for making sure no one else got hurt.
EntranceGuard_0.context: NodeContext: not his chirpy self - reserved and sincere

EntranceGuard_1.speaker: Klaus
EntranceGuard_1.text: I know it's hard to enjoy the circus without Dribbles, but I pray that you do. After all, the show must go on.
EntranceGuard_1.context: NodeContext: trying to be cheerful but a little sad. He misses dribbles

EntranceGuard_2.speaker: Klaus
EntranceGuard_2.text: Do you hear that? The screaming? Damn it, I can't leave my post. If you can, please go in and help!
EntranceGuard_2.context: NodeContext: Sincere, pleading, worried about the other staff inside

EntranceGuard_3.speaker: Klaus
EntranceGuard_3.text: What are you doing wasting time with me? There's a circus to enjoy, my friend! Go on.

EntranceGuard_4.speaker: Klaus
EntranceGuard_4.text: A tip? Don't piss off the djinni. Oh, and if the kobold tries to sell you food? Run. Enjoy the circus!
EntranceGuard_4.context: NodeContext: first half low and conspiratorial (player should wonder if he's just messing with him), second half cheerful.

AD_EntranceChildAndParent_3.speaker: Gable
AD_EntranceChildAndParent_3.text: Do you think Dribbles will have his animal friends with him?

AD_EntranceChildAndParent_1.speaker: Emmet
AD_EntranceChildAndParent_1.text: Of course - he never travels without his friends. Let's go!

AD_EntranceChildAndParent_6.speaker: Emmet
AD_EntranceChildAndParent_6.text: You want to see Dribbles the Clown, don't you?

AD_EntranceChildAndParent_2.speaker: Emmet
AD_EntranceChildAndParent_2.text: Then let's go inside - don't be scared.

AD_EntranceChildAndParent_0.speaker: Emmet
AD_EntranceChildAndParent_0.text: That's just a man in a costume. It's not real.

PAD_ItemFake_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ItemFake_0.text: A fake! See, Boo? You can still taste the paint.

PAD_ItemFake_1.speaker: Player
PAD_ItemFake_1.text: All that glitters is most definitely not gold.

PAD_ItemFake_3.speaker: Player
PAD_ItemFake_3.text: So cheaply made, even I'm embarrassed.

PAD_ItemFake_4.speaker: Player
PAD_ItemFake_4.text: One touch and this will fall apart.

PAD_ItemFake_5.speaker: Player
PAD_ItemFake_5.text: An imp could vomit up a more impressive prize.

PAD_ItemFake_7.speaker: Player
PAD_ItemFake_7.text: Fake. I begin to wonder if the djinn himself is not just some painted blue buffoon.

AD_Patron_01_Help_0.speaker: Flimsy
AD_Patron_01_Help_0.text: Is this part of the show?
AD_Patron_01_Help_0.context: NodeContext: scared, cowering, hiding at the edge of a combat

FacePainter_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Puts hands to head and then drops them low in furstrationNodeContext: Context: frustrated that player can't understand her

FacePainter_1.speaker: Player
FacePainter_1.text: Grunt back menacingly at the mummy.

FacePainter_18.speaker: Zara the Mummy
FacePainter_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: she throws her hands up and shakes them in a "no" gestureNodeContext: heavy muffled mumbling of "no, no, noooo!!!" - fearful of an angry barbarian

FacePainter_4.speaker: Zara the Mummy
FacePainter_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: miming putting on face paints, same anim as greeting nodeNodeContext: slow muffled mumbling of "would you like to buy some facepaint", as if explaining it slower for a dullard - exasperated

FacePainter_12.speaker: Player
FacePainter_12.text: I'd like to see your face-paints.

FacePainter_21.speaker: Zara the Mummy
FacePainter_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Throws her hands up in delight because the player understood herNodeContext: Context: Thankful that player understood her

FacePainter_26.speaker: Zara the Mummy
FacePainter_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowing low in thanksNodeContext: Context:thanking the player

FacePainter_23.speaker: Zara the Mummy
FacePainter_23.context: NodeContext: Mumbling heavily through bandages (intonation should be 'what the hell is going on?!')

FacePainter_27.speaker: Zara the Mummy
FacePainter_27.context: NodeContext: Mumbling heavily through bandages (intonation should be 'this circus has gone to the dogs')

PAD_FoundClownCorpse_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundClownCorpse_0.text: A clown's arm - Dribbles', no doubt.

PAD_FoundClownCorpse_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundClownCorpse_1.text: A foot, smeared with paint... among other things. This must belong to Dribbles.
PAD_FoundClownCorpse_1.context: NodeContext: smells like rotten flesh, eye-wateringly so

PAD_FoundClownCorpse_6.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundClownCorpse_6.text: Wait, I know this head. It belongs to Dribbles the clown!

PAD_FoundClownCorpse_8.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundClownCorpse_8.text: I think that's it - we've found all of him. Time to show the Ringmaster.

PAD_FoundClownCorpse_4.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundClownCorpse_4.text: There can't be much of him left to find. Come on.

PAD_FoundClownCorpse_5.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundClownCorpse_5.text: The question is - where is the rest of him?
PAD_FoundClownCorpse_5.context: InternalNodeContext: "We need to look more for the similar Tableauxes"

PAD_FoundClownCorpse_3.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundClownCorpse_3.text: That can't be all of Dribbles. Come on - let's find the rest.

PAD_FoundClownCorpse_9.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundClownCorpse_9.text: Judging by the state of the leg, this must be part of the clown.

PAD_FoundClownCorpse_10.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundClownCorpse_10.text: A colourful torso, torn and butchered. Hello, Dribbles.

PAD_FoundClownCorpse_11.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundClownCorpse_11.text: Circus clothes? What an end for Dribbles the clown.

PAD_FoundClownCorpse_12.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundClownCorpse_12.text: Bloody, painted fingertips. This hand belonged to Dribbles, no question.

PAD_FoundClownCorpse_13.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundClownCorpse_13.text: This is the head... of a clown. Right.

PAD_FoundClownCorpse_14.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundClownCorpse_14.text: Body parts? Is this some kind of... display?
PAD_FoundClownCorpse_14.context: InternalNodeContext: Please don't mention a specific body part, it can by any but not a hand or head.

Patron_04_0.speaker: Cleet
Patron_04_0.text: You - you started that fight. I saw it with my own two eyes! You're a monster.

Patron_04_2.speaker: Cleet
Patron_04_2.context: NodeContext: scared, hiding at the edge of a combat

Ringmaster_2.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_2.text: Thank you for finding Dribbles, darling. Be sure you don't forget me, hm?

Ringmaster_8.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_8.text: I hope you've cleared your schedule, darling, because I need my Dribbles found. You will be compensated, of course.

Ringmaster_23.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_23.text: Lucille, it's posé, grapevine, then pivot step. Jacob, you have the grace of my great-grandmother's missing leg.
Ringmaster_23.context: NodeContext: Yelling sassily at skeletons she is trying to teach to dance.

Ringmaster_17.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_17.text: And Boris, BORIS. Put some sensuality into those lovely hip bones! I know you have it in you. Step. It. Up.
Ringmaster_17.context: NodeContext: Frustrated but trying, in her own way, to be encouraging

Ringmaster_62.speaker: Player
Ringmaster_62.text: Come quickly. The dryad is in trouble - she disappeared!

Ringmaster_90.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_90.text: Firstly - hello. I'm Lucretious: ringmaster, necromancer, Bringer of the Night - oh, and wine-lover extraordinaire.
Ringmaster_90.context: NodeContext: bemused that player has come up

Ringmaster_6.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_6.text: Secondly - while you panicking about my Zethino is nothing shy of adorable, there is no need. She's likely off partying in the Feywild - lucky thing.

Ringmaster_5.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_5.text: She'll come back when she's ready - she always does. Now, stroll on, darling - I have skellies to train.

Ringmaster_19.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_19.text: Interrupting a massacre, Myrkul help me. These three make the art of dance look like ritual sacrifice.

Ringmaster_35.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_35.text: Call me Lucretious: ringmaster, necromancer, Bringer of the Night - oh, and wine-lover extraordinaire.
Ringmaster_35.context: NodeContext: a little flirty - she's fabulous and she knows it.

Ringmaster_53.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_53.text: Normally I'd invite you into my tent for a lovely vintage, but these graceless skellies need my full attention. Enjoy my circus, darling!

Ringmaster_31.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_31.text: We are decades from that. I hoped they could open for Dribbles - not that my star needs the support, but at this rate... who knows?

Ringmaster_10.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_10.text: Harsh would be telling Jacob that I accidentally resurrected him - I thought his corpse belonged to his much better looking twin.

Ringmaster_80.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_80.text: Don't look at me like that, Jacob - I didn't say it.
Ringmaster_80.context: CinematicNodeContext: I would love a shot of Jacob looking really sad (but not a priority)

Ringmaster_27.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_27.text: Jacob, you mess up that pivot one more time, and I will put you back in the ground. Not now, darling.

Ringmaster_29.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_29.text: That is NOT my Dribbles! I WILL REND THAT PESTILENT IMPOSTOR LIMB FROM LIMB.
Ringmaster_29.context: NodeContext: the composed, carefree Lucretious has absolutely lost it. Near frothing at the mouth angry (the fight on the stage is ongoing, and she's just realised it's not the real dribbles)

Ringmaster_57.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_57.text: Oh dear. Screaming children, an oozing corpse - and it's not even my birthday.

Ringmaster_67.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_67.text: Lucretious: ringmaster, necromancer, Bringer of the Night - oh, and wine-lover extraordinaire. It's a pleasure, darling.

Ringmaster_51.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_51.text: I thought the Absolute wouldn't dare set foot in my circus. To use such a woeful Dribbles impersonator - why, it's downright rude.

Ringmaster_64.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_64.text: As much as I love a good murder, my customers don't. The real Dribbles charms animals and makes puns. Awful puns. Not - this.

Ringmaster_12.speaker: Player
Ringmaster_12.text: You just lost the star of your show - aren't you bothered?

Ringmaster_45.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_45.text: When you run a plane-hopping circus of ragtags and ruffians, few things faze you.

Ringmaster_83.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_83.text: Alas, I cannot afford to lose any more staff - funerals are so very expensive. I need to move the circus.

Ringmaster_55.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_55.text: But I cannot leave just yet - not without Dribbles. He was a star - customers of every colour and creed simply adored him.

Ringmaster_73.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_73.text: I need him back, and I'll shower the person who finds him in love, adoration, and adequate compensation. What do you say?
Ringmaster_73.context: NodeContext: turned up the charm to full

Ringmaster_1.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_1.text: Heh. I can respect that. And you're in luck - because I am old, darling. Ancient. I have seen stars explode and civilisations fall.
Ringmaster_1.context: NodeContext: serious with a slight smirk

Ringmaster_13.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_13.text: Along the way, I happened across items of such power, they would make you weep with awe.

Ringmaster_30.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_30.text: Find my Dribbles - you won't be disappointed.

Ringmaster_16.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_16.text: That's the spirit, darling - and remember, I look after those who make me happy, hm?

Ringmaster_20.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_20.text: Good luck, and thanks ever so much.

Ringmaster_78.speaker: Player
Ringmaster_78.text: Dribbles is dead. The doppelganger killed him.

Ringmaster_28.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_28.text: Oh, well - at least he won't complain about extra rehearsals anymore. Find his corpse for me, will you, darling?

Ringmaster_34.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_34.text: I'll resurrect him - the show must go on, after all! Perhaps I'll make some improvements along the way.

Ringmaster_88.speaker: Player
Ringmaster_88.text: I've actually found Dribbles, or parts of him, at least.

Ringmaster_33.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_33.text: Ohhh, getting hacked up like that must have been unpleasant - poor dear.
Ringmaster_33.context: NodeContext: absolutely no sympathy in her voice here - like she's commenting on the weather

Ringmaster_58.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_58.text: If you bring whatever you find to me, I'll take it from there. I'm a necromancer after all - and I do so love a challenge.
Ringmaster_58.context: NodeContext: more excited at the prospect of a challenge

Ringmaster_76.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_76.text: Even better! Corpses are wonderful employees.

Ringmaster_81.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_81.text: They aren't picky about things like 'working from home' or 'eating'.

Ringmaster_26.speaker: Player
Ringmaster_26.text: Dribbles is dead, but perhaps I could help you resurrect him?

Ringmaster_3.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_3.text: Darling, you know half the fun with these things is getting your own hands dirty.

Ringmaster_79.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_79.text: I'll resurrect him myself - I just need you to find him for me.

Ringmaster_70.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_70.text: Then take care of your affairs and return to me. I trust no one else to find my Dribbles!
Ringmaster_70.context: NodeContext: sassy - expecting player to return asap

Ringmaster_77.speaker: Player
Ringmaster_77.text: I spoke to his corpse - this was planned. You should be worried.

Ringmaster_32.speaker: Player
Ringmaster_32.text: This whole circus would be dead if not for me. You should have been here.

Ringmaster_69.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_69.text: You do not live to see the turn of millennia by being stupid - sorry. 'Brave'.

Ringmaster_61.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_61.text: But since you're so eager to offer your opinion - perhaps you can help me. Dribbles was the star of my show.

Ringmaster_63.speaker: Player
Ringmaster_63.text: I don't know, I enjoyed myself. Killing clowns is a rare treat.

Ringmaster_65.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_65.text: If that's your idea of fun, darling, you and I are going to get along swimmingly.

Ringmaster_72.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_72.text: Hello again, my vicious little warrior. Any luck finding Dribbles?

Ringmaster_22.speaker: Player
Ringmaster_22.text: This is every part of Dribbles I could find.

Ringmaster_59.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_59.text: Oh, perfection. This is just what I need. His flesh has a few rat bites, and his teeth are missing, but these are minor issues.
Ringmaster_59.context: NodeContext: running through (mentally) all the pieces of dribbles the player has brought her

Ringmaster_24.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_24.text: I shall remake Dribbles better than before. Where once he was famous, he will now become legend!
Ringmaster_24.context: NodeContext: excited - thinking of all the money she will make

Ringmaster_36.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_36.text: And you - here, darling. A little something from your friend Lucretious. My circus and I can now finally leave.

Ringmaster_49.speaker: Player
Ringmaster_49.text: It's a big circus - how are you going to get out of the city?

Ringmaster_25.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_25.text: It's called 'magic', darling - do keep up.

Ringmaster_71.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_71.text: Not this instant, so should you wish for anything from my staff - be quick.

Ringmaster_44.speaker: Player
Ringmaster_44.text: It was a pleasure to meet you, Lucretious.

Ringmaster_0.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_0.text: And I you, you delectable vintage.

Ringmaster_11.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_11.text: Oh, and if you do take on the Absolute - do try not to end up like poor Dribbles. You are so very pretty, after all.
Ringmaster_11.context: NodeContext: very cheerful despite how horridying her words are

Ringmaster_40.speaker: Player
Ringmaster_40.text: You wouldn't happen to be hiring, would you?

Ringmaster_84.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_84.text: As much fun as you and I would have on the road, alas no. I think we both know you're destined for greater things.
Ringmaster_84.context: NodeContext: flirty but also unusually serious - she's sincere here

Ringmaster_89.speaker: Player
Ringmaster_89.text: I've actually found Dribbles, or parts of him, at least.

Ringmaster_14.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_14.text: Oh dear - Dribbles' flesh is near torn asunder. Poor thing was most certainly alive when he was hacked up.
Ringmaster_14.context: NodeContext: more focused on the amatuer work - doesn't particular car that dribbles was alive

Ringmaster_46.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_46.text: Well, that just means this treasure hunt is all the more challenging. Toddle on, darling - there's more of Dribbles to find!
Ringmaster_46.context: NodeContext: tone change, very much cheerful and shrugging off the horror

Ringmaster_48.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_48.text: I'd hurry if I were you. In this heat, things tend to get ripe rather quickly... if you catch my meaning.

Ringmaster_7.speaker: Player
Ringmaster_7.text: Come quickly. The dryad is in trouble - she disappeared!

Ringmaster_21.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_21.text: Another Zethino fan? Aren't you just the sweetest thing.
Ringmaster_21.context: NodeContext: little condescending (zethino has A LOT) of fans.

Ringmaster_75.speaker: Lucretious
Ringmaster_75.text: She's likely off partying in the Feywild. She'll be back when she's tuckered out. Don't worry - she does this all the time.

Clown_PreShow_Companions_4.text: Now, you're very special. As special as can be! Does anyone know why?
Clown_PreShow_Companions_4.context: NodeContext: speaking like he's talking to a child, big and exaggerated as he asks the crowd

Clown_PreShow_Companions_1.text: You're special, my friend, because I have a message - just for you!

Vicious smile, whispers. All of dribbles is gone - all that's left is a vicious cold murderer.

ScaredChildMother_0.speaker: Asumi
ScaredChildMother_0.text: I want to go, but if I don't let her majesty here see Dribbles for the third time, I'll never hear the end of it. Kids, right?
ScaredChildMother_0.context: NodeContext: sigh at the beginning, but affection in her voice

ScaredChildMother_1.speaker: Asumi
ScaredChildMother_1.text: Hey, maybe steer clear of the beasties? One of them is near rabid, and the other is looking at us like we're supper.

ScaredChildMother_2.speaker: Asumi
ScaredChildMother_2.text: I have no idea what in the hells happened back there, but I know me and my kid are standing because of you. Thank you.
ScaredChildMother_2.context: NodeContext: shaken up but grateful (they survived an attack because of the player)

ScaredChildMother_3.speaker: Asumi
ScaredChildMother_3.text: Gods, if you hadn't been here... well, it doesn't bear thinking about.
ScaredChildMother_3.context: NodeContext: shaken up but grateful (they survived an attack because of the player)

AD_SculptorAndAssistant_3.speaker: Boney
AD_SculptorAndAssistant_3.text: Oh, darling, don't forget that dragonborn's order. It's due shortly.

AD_SculptorAndAssistant_1.speaker: Stoney
AD_SculptorAndAssistant_1.context: NodeContext: Two sharp crack sounds of rock - excited

AD_SculptorAndAssistant_5.speaker: Boney
AD_SculptorAndAssistant_5.text: Hah. Is someone excited to work on the handsome dragonborn?
AD_SculptorAndAssistant_5.context: NodeContext: affectionate laugh - he knows his wife fancies dragonborn

AD_SculptorAndAssistant_11.speaker: Stoney
AD_SculptorAndAssistant_11.context: NodeContext: sound of rock hitting something and then a rumble of earth - happy

AD_SculptorAndAssistant_6.speaker: Boney
AD_SculptorAndAssistant_6.text: Good! You shall make him magnificent, my darling - I know it.

AD_SculptorAndAssistant_8.speaker: Stoney
AD_SculptorAndAssistant_8.context: NodeContext: sound of rock crashing and hitting the ground - annoyed and frustrated

AD_SculptorAndAssistant_4.speaker: Boney
AD_SculptorAndAssistant_4.text: That drow's nose was as crooked as you carved, my darling. He was simply in denial.
AD_SculptorAndAssistant_4.context: NodeContext: hiw wife is upset over a customer's feedback. He is trying to make her feel better

AD_SculptorAndAssistant_7.speaker: Stoney
AD_SculptorAndAssistant_7.context: NodeContext: a low rumble of earth moving - should sound a little sad

AD_SculptorAndAssistant_2.speaker: Boney
AD_SculptorAndAssistant_2.text: I am not buttering you up - you are the very best at what you do. I promise!

AD_SculptorAndAssistant_10.speaker: Boney
AD_SculptorAndAssistant_10.text: It's been an age since your last break, my darling.

AD_SculptorAndAssistant_0.speaker: Stoney
AD_SculptorAndAssistant_0.context: NodeContext: sound of earth moving - reassuing and gentle

AD_SculptorAndAssistant_9.speaker: Boney
AD_SculptorAndAssistant_9.text: All right, all right - I shall stop fussing.
AD_SculptorAndAssistant_9.context: NodeContext: knows he's fretting, but worries about his wife

Patron_05_0.speaker: Patty
Patron_05_0.text: You took those bastards down like it was nothing. It was... amazing.

PAD_ReturnedFromJungle_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ReturnedFromJungle_0.text: I'm back - and in one piece. Now, where is that djinni?
PAD_ReturnedFromJungle_0.context: NodeContext: Gale: djinni-sore / dinosaur pun - we just escaped from dinosaurs

Korrilla_0.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_0.text: Soon... I promise. Patience is one of few virtues worth holding.

AD_Patron_05_Help_0.speaker: Patty
AD_Patron_05_Help_0.context: NodeContext: Terrified, on the egde of a combat

AD_FortuneWheelWorker_0.speaker: Akabi
AD_FortuneWheelWorker_0.text: WIN PRIZES FOUND ONLY IN THE MOST EXOTIC OF PLANES.

AD_FortuneWheelWorker_1.speaker: Akabi
AD_FortuneWheelWorker_1.text: WILL THE WHEEL OF WONDERS DUB YOU WORTHY? COME - SEE!

AD_FortuneWheelWorker_2.speaker: Akabi
AD_FortuneWheelWorker_2.text: COME, MORTALS, AND TRY YOUR LUCK.

GhoulSniffer_0.speaker: Benji
GhoulSniffer_0.text: *Sniff.* Blood. In the CIRCUS? Without BENJI? Aw.
GhoulSniffer_0.context: NodeContext: gutted to be missing out on the bloodshed

GhoulSniffer_1.speaker: Benji
GhoulSniffer_1.context: NodeContext: Llittle vbit scared of the player, wants them to leave.

GhoulSniffer_2.speaker: Benji
GhoulSniffer_2.text: No like you. *Sniff.* No like your smell.

Clown_Dead_21.speaker: Narrator
Clown_Dead_21.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Clown_Dead_9.speaker: Player
Clown_Dead_9.text: You singled me out from the crowd. Why?

Clown_Dead_3.speaker: Fumm
Clown_Dead_3.text: I saw in your eyes... what I see in my own... death.

Clown_Dead_17.speaker: Player
Clown_Dead_17.text: What type of creature are you?

Clown_Dead_26.speaker: Fumm
Clown_Dead_26.text: A shapechanger... people call us... doppelgangers...

Clown_Dead_19.speaker: Fumm
Clown_Dead_19.text: To sow chaos... it is His will...

Clown_Dead_2.speaker: Fumm
Clown_Dead_2.text: The greatest honour... of them all.

Clown_Dead_8.speaker: Player
Clown_Dead_8.text: It is 'His will'? Who are you talking about?

Clown_Dead_18.speaker: Narrator
Clown_Dead_18.text: *You feel a rush of power, dark and insidious - something prevents the corpse from answering.*

Clown_Dead_1.speaker: Player
Clown_Dead_1.text: What happened to Dribbles the Clown?

Clown_Dead_12.speaker: Fumm
Clown_Dead_12.text: I killed him... bathed in his blood... a death worthy of the list... of the Tribunal.

Clown_Dead_15.speaker: Fumm
Clown_Dead_15.text: Mistress needed his body parts... for her art...

Clown_Dead_27.speaker: Narrator
Clown_Dead_27.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

DancingSkeletons_0.speaker: Narrator
DancingSkeletons_0.text: *Little remains of the person this skeleton once was - only polished bone and brittle teeth.*

DancingSkeletons_1.speaker: Narrator
DancingSkeletons_1.text: *The skeleton looks beyond you, frozen - awaiting command from its mistress.*

EntranceCivilian_0.speaker: Montgomery
EntranceCivilian_0.text: What's this - what in the hells is all the yelling about? Is this another show?
EntranceCivilian_0.context: NodeContext: little panic, can hear screams in the distance

EntranceCivilian_1.speaker: Montgomery
EntranceCivilian_1.text: I've heard the djinni is something else. This circus better be worth the hassle.

EntranceCivilian_2.speaker: Montgomery
EntranceCivilian_2.text: Did you see that bloody ghoul at the entrance? Sniffing us, of all things! What kind of circus is this?

BackupPerformer_01_0.speaker: High-Wire Hildeh
BackupPerformer_01_0.text: We once angered the Faerie Queen's court during a misjudged performance in the Feywild. Your city scares me more than she did.
BackupPerformer_01_0.context: NodeContext: indignant and a little bit afraid

BackupPerformer_01_1.speaker: High-Wire Hildeh
BackupPerformer_01_1.text: Welcome, welcome. All the wonders of the Feywild are here, with only a smattering of the dangers!

BackupPerformer_01_3.speaker: High-Wire Hildeh
BackupPerformer_01_3.text: This is terrible - the circus is supposed to be a safe place. For us performers at least.
BackupPerformer_01_3.context: NodeContext: nervous, she can hear fighting nearby

BackupPerformer_01_4.speaker: High-Wire Hildeh
BackupPerformer_01_4.text: Do not stand too close. The flames have a life of their own!
BackupPerformer_01_4.context: NodeContext: cheerful - not a real warning of danger. Showmanship.

PAD_EnteredJungle_0.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteredJungle_0.text: Damn that djinni. Where am I?
PAD_EnteredJungle_0.context: InternalNodeContext: | Where for the Nine Hells am I?! Oh, no! I need to stay hidden or I’ll end up as a dinner for these creatures. |NodeContext: Keeping the voice down, the character is sneaking (internal speech?)

PAD_FakeTreasurePile_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FakeTreasurePile_0.text: A shiny shell with nothing inside. Minsc has known many wizards just the same.

PAD_FakeTreasurePile_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FakeTreasurePile_1.text: No treasure here - only a simulacrum of it.

PAD_FakeTreasurePile_2.speaker: Player
PAD_FakeTreasurePile_2.text: Only an idiot would think this was anything but fake.
