Clown_PreShow_56.text: Huzzah! Should this prove embarassing, just imagine the audience in the nude.

Clown_PreShow_92.speaker: Karlach
Clown_PreShow_92.text: Ah come on, soldier, you've been through worse - nearly.

Clown_PreShow_109.speaker: Halsin
Clown_PreShow_109.text: Oak Father protect you, my friend! You shall weather this trial, I know it!
Clown_PreShow_109.context: NodeContext: Calling out sincere encouragement (the player has been forced to participate in a clown's stage act. Halsin doesn't understand the concept)

Clown_PreShow_126.speaker: Jaheira
Clown_PreShow_126.text: Hmph. A proper circus would provide some fruit to throw.
Clown_PreShow_126.context: NodeContext: Amused, watching the player get dragged up on stage by a clown while the crowd cheers on

Clown_PreShow_146.speaker: Minsc
Clown_PreShow_146.text: HAH, THAT IS OUR FRIEND! BOO WISHES TO SEE THE TRICK WITH THE KNIVES!
Clown_PreShow_146.context: NodeContext: Appropriately Minsc volume - supporting the player as they go on stage with the clown. First line earnestly bragging to crowd, second line making a request

Clown_PreShow_165.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Clown_PreShow_165.text: If all else fails, kill the clown. That is sure to amuse the crowd.
Clown_PreShow_165.context: NodeContext: watching a friend take the stage at a circus, expecting them to be humiliated by a clown. she's only half-joking about the merits of killing the clown for laughs

Clown_PreShow_144.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
Clown_PreShow_144.text: Have I only mice in the audience, or does someone here know the meaning of courage?
Clown_PreShow_144.context: NodeContext: dramatic, looking for rile the crowd up so someone will volunteer

Clown_PreShow_64.speaker: Quinton
Clown_PreShow_64.context: NodeContext: volunteers from the crowd - excited and delighted. He's always wanted to be in a dribbles show

Clown_PreShow_89.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
Clown_PreShow_89.text: Finally - someone with steel in their spine! Come on up!
Clown_PreShow_89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fan eagerly runs onto the stage - stop beside dribbles.

Clown_PreShow_143.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
Clown_PreShow_143.text: Before we begin, I owe you all a most humble apology. This wasn't how the show was supposed to go.
Clown_PreShow_143.context: NodeContext: Looking to crowd - making an exaggerated sad face. Heartfelt and sincere.

Clown_PreShow_11.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
Clown_PreShow_11.text: I chose you - yet you refused me. So know that this...
Clown_PreShow_11.context: NodeContext: speaking to player - gestures to confused fan. Sounds BIT more menacing, but the mask hasn't quite dropped yet. Still smiling and cheeful.

Clown_PreShow_28.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
Clown_PreShow_28.context: NodeContext: tone drops - the mask is gone. He sounds cruel and vicious. This is the big 'hail hydra' moment.

Clown_PreShow_135.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dog slashes the NPC's chest - they fall and die. Combat begins.

Clown_PreShow_133.speaker: Narrator
Clown_PreShow_133.text: *The hair on the back of your neck raises as a shiver passes through you.*

Clown_PreShow_154.speaker: Narrator
Clown_PreShow_154.text: *A bloodthirsty rush of fury engulfs you. You want to butcher the crowd, women and children alike, and soak in their innards. It is glorious.*

Clown_PreShow_167.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
Clown_PreShow_167.text: You hear that, Buddy? We've got ourselves a Debbie Downer!
Clown_PreShow_167.context: NodeContext: AGHAST. Who would dare be a debbie downer????

Clown_PreShow_151.speaker: Quinton
Clown_PreShow_151.context: NodeContext: Big over the top BOO. Cupping hands to face, in crowd.

Clown_PreShow_158.speaker: Player
Clown_PreShow_158.text: Relax and enjoy the show - it's been forever since you've seen Dribbles perform.

Clown_PreShow_169.speaker: Player
Clown_PreShow_169.text: Sure did - his opponent was really clutching at straws!

Clown_PreShow_36.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
Clown_PreShow_36.text: Wa-hey! Looks like we've got a proper comedian in our midst!
Clown_PreShow_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reuse Wahey anim for dribbles on this node

Clown_PreShow_31.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
Clown_PreShow_31.text: Good thing too, I'll need someone with your wits for my next trick. Now, where are you...?
Clown_PreShow_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: leaning forward on last line, hands to eyes, to get a better look at player0NodeContext: Puts his hands to his eyes and dramatically scans the crowd - suddenly locks eyes with the player.

Clown_PreShow_207.speaker: Minsc
Clown_PreShow_207.context: NodeContext: Slow burn. Minsc is in the crowd as a clown makes a terrible joke. He gets it a second later then everyone else, but enjoys it ten times as much.

Clown_PreShow_59.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Clown_PreShow_59.text: Just give the word, and I will kill the clown. We would be praised as heroes.
Clown_PreShow_59.context: NodeContext: reaction to watching a clown deliver bad puns on a stage. She's not serious about being prasied as heroes, but she really would like to kill the clown, even though she knows it's inappropriate/illegal.

DressingRoomSleeper_0.speaker: Roustabout Vix
DressingRoomSleeper_0.text: Urgh - why did you wake me? Bloody hells - I was up half the night grooming Buddy for the show. Blighter bit me.
DressingRoomSleeper_0.context: NodeContext: player has just woken them up - grumpy and yawning

DressingRoomSleeper_1.speaker: Roustabout Vix
DressingRoomSleeper_1.text: Unless you have some sort of animal grooming emergency, leave me be.

DressingRoomSleeper_2.speaker: Roustabout Vix
DressingRoomSleeper_2.text: How could Madam Lucretious let this happen? And what are you doing back here? Out!

DressingRoomSleeper_3.speaker: Roustabout Vix
DressingRoomSleeper_3.context: NodeContext: panicked, assumes the player is an enemy. Cowering.

DressingRoomSleeper_4.speaker: Roustabout Vix
DressingRoomSleeper_4.text: Any of us could be next - I need to pack...

AD_Patron_02_Help_0.speaker: Gloria
AD_Patron_02_Help_0.text: I always knew I'd die at a circus.
AD_Patron_02_Help_0.context: NodeContext: terrified, hiding at the edge of a combat

Thug_01_0.speaker: Doppelganger
Thug_01_0.text: Ah bloody hells - Crimson did a runner. I'm gonna get my head kicked in for this.

Thug_01_1.speaker: Doppelganger
Thug_01_1.text: Don't get too close, or Crimson here might decide you look tasty.
Thug_01_1.context: NodeContext: being mean - hoping that will happen

Thug_01_2.speaker: Doppelganger
Thug_01_2.text: If Crimson bites them little fingies off, don't come crying to me.
Thug_01_2.context: NodeContext: being mean, hoping that will happen

AD_Poster_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_Poster_0.text: *The Circus of the Last Days has RETURNED! See dryads, djinn, and Dribbles the Clown - back with a new act!*
AD_Poster_0.context: NodeContext: note to narrator - feel free to go ham on this, if you think that works!

CuriousFan_0.speaker: Quinton
CuriousFan_0.text: I can't believe Dribbles did this - the Dribbles.
CuriousFan_0.context: NodeContext: upset, feeling personally betrayed (dribbles attacked the crowd)

CuriousFan_1.speaker: Quinton
CuriousFan_1.text: I've seen Dribbles' show so many times. He's always so happy, and so funny! Was it all a big fat lie?
CuriousFan_1.context: NodeContext: upset, feeling personally betrayed (dribbles attacked the crowd)

CuriousFan_2.speaker: Quinton
CuriousFan_2.text: What is happening? What is Dribbles doing?

AD_Clown_Attack_0.speaker: GROUP_ACT3_WYR_Circus_RealClown
AD_Clown_Attack_0.text: So eager to bleed? Very well. Praise the Absolute!

Thug_02_1.speaker: Doppelganger
Thug_02_1.text: Don't get too close - beasties are hungry, and you look like food.

Thug_02_2.speaker: Doppelganger
Thug_02_2.text: Why don't you watch the show? You're in for a treat.

PAD_PostCombat_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PostCombat_0.text: A shapeshifter? At least we didn't murder the actual clown.
PAD_PostCombat_0.context: InternalNodeContext: |Thank gods he was a shapeshifter. Otherwise we'd have murdered a clown in front of a crowd!|

PAD_PostCombat_1.speaker: Player
PAD_PostCombat_1.text: Another shapeshifter - I wonder if the real Dribbles has better jokes?
PAD_PostCombat_1.context: InternalNodeContext: |Another shifter. Well, at least we didn't murder an actual clown in front of a crowd.|

FlamingFist_02_0.speaker: Fist Wayne
FlamingFist_02_0.text: I suggest you go home and lock your door - we'll take it from here.
FlamingFist_02_0.context: NodeContext: concerned, worried for the city and the innocent people here

FlamingFist_02_1.speaker: Fist Wayne
FlamingFist_02_1.text: Show's over. Those Absolute bastards slaughtered the ringmaster - we're lucky there weren't more casualties.
FlamingFist_02_1.context: NodeContext: concerned, worried for the city and the innocent people here

Beast_02_0.speaker: Crimson
Beast_02_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Head down, eating. NodeContext: Eating. Mouth full, joy.

Beast_02_7.speaker: Crimson
Beast_02_7.text: Your scent - your friend freed me from hunger's lust.

Beast_02_31.speaker: Crimson
Beast_02_31.text: Forgive me. I was close to killing you - killing everyone. I am ashamed.

Beast_02_29.speaker: Player
Beast_02_29.text: Your friend, the displacer beast, seemed hells-bent on killing everyone, too.

Beast_02_3.speaker: Crimson
Beast_02_3.text: Her pain and fury are festering wounds - she sees the hunters who murdered her cubs in every face.
Beast_02_3.context: NodeContext: discussing the displacer beast in the other cage. Voice full of empathy for his friend, even if she would reect it

Beast_02_32.speaker: Crimson
Beast_02_32.text: Dribbles is - was - helping her see life anew. But she was not ready.
Beast_02_32.context: NodeContext: sadness - he saw dribbles as a friend

Beast_02_26.speaker: Crimson
Beast_02_26.text: You are like Dribbles. You chose to save her - from herself. She will not thank you - but I do.

Beast_02_16.speaker: Player
Beast_02_16.text: If anyone should feel ashamed, it's the circus - they were starving you!

Beast_02_52.speaker: Crimson
Beast_02_52.text: The circus is my family - they rescued me when I was but a youngling. They did not starve me - the other did.

Beast_02_21.speaker: Crimson
Beast_02_21.text: He wore the face of Dribbles, but the scent of a stranger. He taunted me, waving bloodied rags under my nose. My mind was worn from the hunger.

Beast_02_22.speaker: Crimson
Beast_02_22.text: Thank you for calming me - before I hurt my family.

Beast_02_34.speaker: Player
Beast_02_34.text: You deserve to be treated better - I'll open up your cage.

Beast_02_54.speaker: Crimson
Beast_02_54.text: You can, but I will not cross the threshold.

Beast_02_53.speaker: Player
Beast_02_53.text: I'd have killed you before you hurt anyone here.

Beast_02_25.speaker: Crimson
Beast_02_25.text: And with my dying breath I would have thanked you.

Beast_02_15.speaker: Narrator
Beast_02_15.text: *You meet a cold stare marked by ferocity.*

Beast_02_24.speaker: Crimson
Beast_02_24.text: You - you freed me from hunger's lust.

Beast_02_13.speaker: Narrator
Beast_02_13.text: *With every bite, the beast seems to calm.*

Beast_02_28.speaker: Crimson
Beast_02_28.text: May you and your family have full bellies and a warm place to rest - always. Be well.

Beast_02_45.speaker: Narrator
Beast_02_45.text: *Sated by his meal, the beast's eyes shine with gratitude.*

Beast_02_48.speaker: Crimson
Beast_02_48.text: The HUNGER. My stomach SCREAMS. Press your FLESH through BARS. A hand. A HEAD. BLOOD. Meat.
Beast_02_48.context: NodeContext: Frothing out the mouth, INSANE with hunger.

Beast_02_18.speaker: Player
Beast_02_18.text: Here - I have something else you can eat.

Beast_02_37.speaker: Crimson
Beast_02_37.context: CinematicNodeContext: player does a throwing motion to toss something into cage, Crimson dips his head to eat ravenously.NodeContext: player has dropped meat on the ground in front of him. Dips head eating ravenously.

Beast_02_5.speaker: Player
Beast_02_5.text: I don't have any food for you, but I'll be back - I promise.

Beast_02_46.speaker: Crimson
Beast_02_46.text: NO. Flesh. Meat. NOW. NOW. NOW.
Beast_02_46.context: NodeContext: Player has said they don't have any meat. Losing his MIND. Roaring, yelling, in pain with the hunger.

Beast_02_38.speaker: Player
Beast_02_38.text: You aren't getting a bite out of me.

Beast_02_47.speaker: Crimson
Beast_02_47.text: BLOOD soaked. JAW locked. FEAST ON ALL. ALL.
Beast_02_47.context: NodeContext: Player has refused to feed Crimson. He's losing MIND. Roaring, yelling, in pain with the hunger.

Beast_02_49.speaker: Crimson
Beast_02_49.text: Let me BITE YOU. BLEED YOU. Meat. MEAT.
Beast_02_49.context: NodeContext: Frothing out the mouth, INSANE with hunger.

Beast_02_51.speaker: Narrator
Beast_02_51.text: *Teeth bared, the creature is near rabid in his bloodlust.*

Beast_02_11.speaker: Player
Beast_02_11.text: Easy, I'm not going to hurt you.

Beast_02_9.speaker: Player
Beast_02_9.text: Mimic the beast's body language to get a closer look.

Beast_02_35.speaker: Narrator
Beast_02_35.text: *Hollow eyes, pale gums - this beast isn't angry, he's starving.*

Beast_02_1.speaker: Player
Beast_02_1.text: You hungry, boy? You want some meat?

Beast_02_4.speaker: Narrator
Beast_02_4.text: *At the mention of the word 'meat', his stance softens.*

Beast_02_42.speaker: Narrator
Beast_02_42.text: *He whimpers in gratitude and falls on the morsel instantly.*

Beast_02_6.speaker: Player
Beast_02_6.text: I don't have any food for you, but I will be back - I promise.

Beast_02_20.speaker: Narrator
Beast_02_20.text: *The creature stares at you with unmitigated fury - marking you as his next meal.*

Beast_02_10.speaker: Narrator
Beast_02_10.text: *You can tell only one thing - this beast will kill at the first opportunity.*

DressingRoomWorker_0.speaker: Elyna
DressingRoomWorker_0.text: Quiet - it's the middle of Dribbles' show!

DressingRoomWorker_2.speaker: Elyna
DressingRoomWorker_2.text: I've seen Dribbles' show a thousand time, but he's never failed to make me smile. He didn't deserve this.
DressingRoomWorker_2.context: NodeContext: horrified - just saw dribbles die

DressingRoomWorker_3.speaker: Elyna
DressingRoomWorker_3.text: How could this happen - to Dribbles? To my home? Can't believe we had to rely on a stranger to save us - no offence.
DressingRoomWorker_3.context: NodeContext: horrified - just saw dribbles die

DressingRoomWorker_4.speaker: Elyna
DressingRoomWorker_4.context: NodeContext: in the middle of combat

Bard_0.speaker: Viola Silvertongue
Bard_0.text: Another bard? Did Lucretious hire you? Tch. Stay out of my way, talentless half-wit.

Bard_1.speaker: Viola Silvertongue
Bard_1.text: Let's hope a ballad will lift everyone's spirits, eh?
Bard_1.context: NodeContext: trying to reassure the player

Bard_2.speaker: Viola Silvertongue
Bard_2.text: I wonder where the circus will go next? Madam Lucretious said the Shadowfell, but I'm pretty sure she was joking...

Bard_3.speaker: Viola Silvertongue
Bard_3.text: Aren't you the adoring fan? Can't talk - I'm in the middle of a performance!

Bard_4.speaker: Viola Silvertongue
Bard_4.text: I - I'm supposed to keep playing no matter what, but what the hells is going on?
Bard_4.context: NodeContext: nervous, she can hear fighting nearby

Bard_5.speaker: Viola Silvertongue
Bard_5.text: Viola Silvertongue - at your service. Or I will be, once my set is done!

Bard_6.speaker: Viola Silvertongue
Bard_6.text: We're leaving already? I was this close to performing in the Elfsong. Oh well - enjoy my dulcet tones while you can!

Bard_7.speaker: Viola Silvertongue
Bard_7.text: The, ah, attack is nothing to worry about - Madam Lucretious has everything under control. Enjoy the circus!
Bard_7.context: NodeContext: trying to reassure the player

Bard_8.speaker: Viola Silvertongue
Bard_8.text: We've got plenty bards as is - so talk a long walk off a short cliff, yeah?

BackupPerformer_02_0.speaker: Glingo Trapeze-Master
BackupPerformer_02_0.text: Dribbles taught me everything I know.
BackupPerformer_02_0.context: NodeContext: trying and failing not to cry

BackupPerformer_02_1.speaker: Glingo Trapeze-Master
BackupPerformer_02_1.text: Dribbles' show isn't just entertainment - it's art. I hope to one day open for him!

BackupPerformer_02_2.speaker: Glingo Trapeze-Master
BackupPerformer_02_2.text: Please remain calm and exit the circus - your safety comes first!
BackupPerformer_02_2.context: NodeContext: can hear a fight happening near by

BackupPerformer_02_3.speaker: Glingo Trapeze-Master
BackupPerformer_02_3.text: Please, eh, enjoy... enjoy the circus, which will never be the same without Dribbles.
BackupPerformer_02_3.context: NodeContext: trying and failing not to cry

BackupPerformer_02_4.speaker: Glingo Trapeze-Master
BackupPerformer_02_4.text: Enjoying the show? Then you're going to love Dribbles! He's about to perform on stage.

RedcapCleaner_001_0.speaker: Fred
RedcapCleaner_001_0.text: BAH! Scummy ballbag - move! I GOTS TO CLEAN.
RedcapCleaner_001_0.context: NodeContext: hates cleaning and is pissed he has to do it

RedcapCleaner_001_1.speaker: Fred
RedcapCleaner_001_1.context: NodeContext: hates cleaning and is pissed he has to do it

LoveDryad_48.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_48.text: There is violence afoot. Until it is resolved, I cannot in good conscience see any customers. Guard yourself, little one.

LoveDryad_74.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_74.text: You return, stira. Shall I look into your hearts, yours and your beloved's both, and see if your love will stand the test of time? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

LoveDryad_179.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_179.text: Violence erupts here - my home. My refuge in this city of stone and steel. Solace escapes me...

LoveDryad_200.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_200.text: Your love may be wanting, little one, but your heart will find its path.
LoveDryad_200.context: NodeContext: player failed the love test but zethino is trying to be gentle with them

LoveDryad_279.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_279.text: There is a great love amongst you - Zethino senses it. Bring your leader to me, and we shall see if your love is that of ages.

LoveDryad_380.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_380.text: You have already sought Zethino's guidance, little one. Nurture and protect your love - for it is one of life's most precious gifts.

LoveDryad_438.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_438.text: Your guise may fool the others, but Zethino knows your heart - you have already sought guidance. Let others have their turn.
LoveDryad_438.context: NodeContext: Player has tried to disguise themselves and try the love test again

LoveDryad_510.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_510.text: This city of stone and steel is an endless scream in nature's womb. I have felt no peace here. Until now.

LoveDryad_390.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_390.text: Your eyes, stira. There is pain, endless and deep. But also devotion - blazing like the sun. You're in love, are you not?

LoveDryad_312.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_312.text: I do love someone - someone close to me, actually.

LoveDryad_175.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_175.text: You are wise to admit it. When it comes to love, vulnerability is armour. Truth, a sword. And trust, a shield. I pray you wield all three, stira.

LoveDryad_137.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_137.text: Bring the one you love. I will look into your hearts and see if your love is eternal. Or doomed eternally.

LoveDryad_109.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_109.text: Bring the one you love to me. I will look into your hearts and see if your love is eternal. Or doomed eternally. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

LoveDryad_116.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_116.text: I wish I could play, but I seem to be a little short.

LoveDryad_56.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_56.text: Return a time anew. With hearts, as well as pockets, full.

LoveDryad_278.speaker: Shadowheart
LoveDryad_278.text: It can't hurt, I suppose - unless you embarrass me. Then you might find yourself hurting in a whole manner of ways.
LoveDryad_278.context: NodeContext: Half-joking warning to a lover.

LoveDryad_318.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_318.text: Close your eyes, little ones. Be still as stone to earth. And remember to breathe.

LoveDryad_145.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Players close their eyes, when they open them, they are somewhere like the meadow with daisy, or the waterfall from SH's romance. Zethino is a disembodied voice. 

Extreme close-up on the eyes of player to help with the transition

LoveDryad_478.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_478.text: Ah. Glorious. Your bond is sweeter than nature's dew. I see you. Know you. But do you know one another?

LoveDryad_337.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_337.text: Shadowheart: an endless storm surges behind sharp eyes.

LoveDryad_232.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_232.text: Listen. Think. From where does Shadowheart draw comfort on a cold, dark night?

LoveDryad_573.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_573.text: Good company and an even better vintage.

LoveDryad_162.speaker: Shadowheart
LoveDryad_162.text: Well put. Though I'll forgive a middling wine so long as the company makes up the difference...
LoveDryad_162.context: CinematicNodeContext: Coy/flirty smile.NodeContext: Flirty/playful. Company being the player.

LoveDryad_384.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player makes the first step towards the companion

LoveDryad_168.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_168.text: Your bond beats in pleasure. It is an honour to behold.

LoveDryad_4.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_4.text: Hear how your bond thrums with pleasure. Strong. Vital. Pulsing with affection.

LoveDryad_373.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_373.text: The heart craves comfort, but needs respect. How does one earn the dark-haired maiden's respect?

LoveDryad_502.speaker: Shadowheart
LoveDryad_502.text: Very good. (Just don't say it so loud.)
LoveDryad_502.context: NodeContext: Approving. Second sentence jokingly spoken in a stage whisper.

LoveDryad_594.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player takes a second step, moving even closer to the center for the trunk to the companion.

LoveDryad_404.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_404.text: Our touch has been that of sunlight, but now we must ask the deep. The difficult.

LoveDryad_518.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_518.text: The sweetest loves dance lightly on the tongue. But now we must dig deeper. Into the most painful reaches of the spirit.

LoveDryad_301.speaker: Shadowheart
LoveDryad_301.text: Not completely off the mark, but there's easier paths into my good graces...

LoveDryad_365.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_365.text: Do not fear - there is time yet. For our touch has been light, but now we must dig deep - deeper than any other.

LoveDryad_440.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_440.text: Shame sits in the soul of all - to tame it, we must name it. Shadowheart - what is her deepest shame?

LoveDryad_82.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_82.text: She doesn't know who she is, or where she belongs.

LoveDryad_354.speaker: Shadowheart
LoveDryad_354.text: Hardly. My association with you might be a contender after that attempt...
LoveDryad_354.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed. The player flubbed a question about what her deepest shame is.

LoveDryad_194.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_194.text: Sacrificing an innocent for her own ambitions.

LoveDryad_46.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_46.text: Failing her goddess when it counted the most.

LoveDryad_402.speaker: Shadowheart
LoveDryad_402.text: I didn't think a little game would sting so much when I agreed to this... but you're right.
LoveDryad_402.context: NodeContext: A bit of a raw nerve

LoveDryad_432.context: CinematicNodeContext: The companion moves close to the avatar.

LoveDryad_569.speaker: Shadowheart
LoveDryad_569.text: A perfect score - I'm flattered. Have you been studying up on me every night at camp?

LoveDryad_357.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_357.text: I press my finger to your bond and find a shield - impenetrable. It is... beautiful.

LoveDryad_128.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_128.text: How close you are. Two hearts beating a perfect rhythm.
LoveDryad_128.context: NodeContext: Admiring, but with the sense there's a 'but' coming (IS ORIN)

LoveDryad_310.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_310.text: But I know the truth. Only one face haunts your dreams each night. Close your eyes, sweetness, and she will come to you...
LoveDryad_310.context: CinematicNodeContext: At Zethino's instruction the player closes their eyes -NodeContext: Getting creepy  (IS ORIN)

LoveDryad_492.speaker: Shadowheart
LoveDryad_492.text: You didn't do abysmally, I suppose. That's worth something.

LoveDryad_439.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_439.text: Your bond a seedling - one that needs a gentle hand in its tending. Nurture it and it will become a great oak, in time.

LoveDryad_15.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_15.text: Your love is one few have - cherish it.

LoveDryad_391.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_391.text: Go in peace, seedlings. And know that you made one whose heart was long quiet beat with love anew.

LoveDryad_183.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_183.text: Your bond is false, and I know why. Because your heart belongs to another.

LoveDryad_244.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_244.text: Close your eyes, and she will show herself to you.
LoveDryad_244.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player closes their eyes - NodeContext: Getting creepy  (IS ORIN)

LoveDryad_557.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Darkness as the dryad's vision ends. When the player opens their eyes, it is Orin stood before them. She smiles wickedly.

Extreme close-up on the eyes of player to help with the transition

LoveDryad_487.speaker: Orin
LoveDryad_487.text: Look at it, come crawling home, hands stained with the Bone Lord's soot. And you carry his stone.
LoveDryad_487.context: NodeContext: 'It' is the Dark Urge player. 'Home' at this point is just the city, not yet the temple. 'Bone Lord's soot' refers to the player having killed Ketheric (his god Myrkul is the Lord of Bones)

LoveDryad_335.speaker: Orin
LoveDryad_335.text: You waste time soft-soothing these flesh bags for the knife.
LoveDryad_335.context: NodeContext: Player demonstrated they have a strong bond with their closest companion. Orin practical - wy pretend to care when you'll only murder them anyway

LoveDryad_81.speaker: Orin
LoveDryad_81.text: You let such ruptured creatures swim in your blood wake. One little skull poke and you forget how to drown them.
LoveDryad_81.context: NodeContext: Player showed they have a poor bond with their closest companion. Orin doesn't understand why you'd bother keeping them around. 'Skull poke' refers to her putting tadppole in your skull.

LoveDryad_309.speaker: Orin
LoveDryad_309.text: I could end it now - but I'll be patient. Father will see us together again. He will see you bleed.
LoveDryad_309.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Toying with the player, trying to make them uneasy, establish her power over them. 'Father' is Bhaal.

LoveDryad_203.speaker: Orin
LoveDryad_203.text: I see how you slip-slither closer, belly dragging in the filth. Father is laughing at you.
LoveDryad_203.context: NodeContext: Second time Orin appeared to toy with you. She can't believe you're wasting so much time.

LoveDryad_71.speaker: Orin
LoveDryad_71.text: Do not worry, slaughter kin. My blades are still sharp and sweet. They will greet you soon enough.
LoveDryad_71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Mocking reassurance - trying to make the player uneasy.

LoveDryad_352.speaker: Orin
LoveDryad_352.text: So you're the lickspittle who crushed the Bone Lord's thrall.
LoveDryad_352.context: NodeContext: First time Orin meets player. 'Bone Lord's thrall' is Ketheric, who player previously killed. Curious.

LoveDryad_47.speaker: Orin
LoveDryad_47.text: Have you come beg-begging, sniffing for our stones? Gortash won't like that. A throat his black hand can't choke the spit from.
LoveDryad_47.context: NodeContext: Mocking, finds your plan ridiculous but enjoys the chaos it will cause. 'Stones' are the netherstones. 'Black hand' reference to the 'Black Hand of Bane', Gortash's god.

LoveDryad_54.speaker: Orin
LoveDryad_54.text: Your bond will not save you. He will wrap its cord around your neck and make you swing from it.
LoveDryad_54.context: NodeContext: Player demonstrated they have a strong bond with their closest companion. Smug/superior - likes the idea you and your companion will suffer because of your bond. 'He' is Gortash, implying he might turn the player's love for the companion against them.

LoveDryad_39.speaker: Orin
LoveDryad_39.text: This wretch following in your worm wake won't help you. Your bond is brittle, the kind the tyrant longs to break.
LoveDryad_39.context: NodeContext: Player showed they have a poor bond with their closest companion. Orin smug that you have such poor bonds with your allies. 'Worm' is the companion you did the quiz with. 'The tyrant' is Gortash, implication being he'll exploit the fact you aren't close to your allies.

LoveDryad_362.speaker: Orin
LoveDryad_362.text: When you find the lordling, tell him Orin is watching.
LoveDryad_362.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Playful, menacing. Trying to make player uneasy - she could be hiding anywhere.

LoveDryad_480.speaker: Orin
LoveDryad_480.text: Still rolling in the muck, I see.

LoveDryad_235.speaker: Orin
LoveDryad_235.text: Gortash knows you are coming. Knows you have the Bone Lord's stone. Do not let him hiss hot air into your worm-weakened brain.
LoveDryad_235.context: NodeContext: Acting like she's helping you, but just trying to freak you out. 'Bone Lord's stone' is Ketheric's netherstone

LoveDryad_249.speaker: Orin
LoveDryad_249.text: Remember - his throat spits lies, but my blade carves the truth. You will read it on your skin soon enough.
LoveDryad_249.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: toying with the player, knows the 'truth' about them and is enjoying holding this against them

LoveDryad_178.speaker: Shadowheart
LoveDryad_178.text: I suppose I should be grateful - you helped me shed any illusions that you might have been paying attention. Thank you.
LoveDryad_178.context: NodeContext: Acidic. The player failed every single 'how well do you know your lover' question at a carnival attraction

LoveDryad_70.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_70.text: A pity. I thought your bond a mighty oak. Instead, it is kindling - a brush of fire shall make it crumble.

LoveDryad_408.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_408.text: But do not despair, seedlings. You are young - you will find love.

LoveDryad_243.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_243.text: It will simply not be with one another. Farewell.

LoveDryad_474.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_474.text: There is a hollowness between you, something brittle and strained. We must dig deeper. Grasp the pain hiding within.

LoveDryad_561.speaker: Shadowheart
LoveDryad_561.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mortified facial expression.NodeContext: Mortified

LoveDryad_369.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_369.text: The knowledge that she can change, just as sure as night will give way to day.

LoveDryad_61.speaker: Shadowheart
LoveDryad_61.text: I see. Are you sure you don't want to quit while you're behind?
LoveDryad_61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unimpressed deadpan facial expressionNodeContext: Unimpressed deadpan (the player guessed a 'know your spouse' carnival game question incorrectly)

LoveDryad_311.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_311.text: Your bond tears but it does not break - have hope.

LoveDryad_473.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_473.text: All affections face their trials. Your bond quivers, but it does not yet break.

LoveDryad_599.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_599.text: I see you. I see the bond between you. So tender. So fragile. But do you see it for yourselves?

LoveDryad_454.speaker: Shadowheart
LoveDryad_454.text: Love, is it? I hadn't realised I'd bowled you over that much. Give it a try, then - impress me.

LoveDryad_12.speaker: Shadowheart
LoveDryad_12.text: I say you'd better start looking for your true love, because it's not me.

LoveDryad_355.speaker: Shadowheart
LoveDryad_355.text: What do I say? Melon... donkey... sunrise? Whichever words will get you to leave me out of this.

LoveDryad_322.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_322.text: How about it, Lae'zel? Want to give it a go?

LoveDryad_67.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_67.text: Yes. But be warned - I play to win.

LoveDryad_103.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_103.text: Lae'zel: passions of the heart and the blade wage war in her soul.

LoveDryad_259.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_259.text: Listen. Think. What does she most desire?

LoveDryad_38.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_38.text: You know me as I know myself. Glory be to my queen.

LoveDryad_187.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_187.text: I would not be ascended - not by my own will, and not by Vlaakith's. Are you truly so indifferent to me?

LoveDryad_282.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_282.text: To find the truth about Orpheus amidst her queen's lies.

LoveDryad_250.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_250.text: You hear my words, you see my path. It is good to be known.

LoveDryad_65.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_65.text: Nonsense - my faith remains strong. Do you think so little of me that you'd believe this?

LoveDryad_336.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_336.text: Bah - trivialities. Have you been so inattentive?

LoveDryad_102.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_102.text: Many things delight the heart, but only one makes it sing. Tell me, what is the githyanki's fondest memory?

LoveDryad_326.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_326.text: The closeness of her kin at Crèche K'liir.

LoveDryad_64.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_64.text: What would you know of K'liir? I trained, I studied, I excelled. I had no need of friends.

LoveDryad_171.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_171.text: Mm. I took my pleasure, and it was done. I've devoted few thoughts to it since.

LoveDryad_571.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_571.text: A fateful night. I'm not apt to forget it - or who spent it with me.

LoveDryad_514.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_514.text: Tearing the limbs from the beasts of the Sea of Night.

LoveDryad_99.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_99.text: Well observed. There is no fouler scent - and no sweeter - than that of a neogi's blood.

LoveDryad_193.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_193.text: Life is brief - finite. When the warrior dies, what legacy will she leave behind?

LoveDryad_556.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_556.text: None. Her name will be lost to time.

LoveDryad_231.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_231.text: I suggest you stop speaking - for your own health, of course.

LoveDryad_73.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_73.text: She will live in perpetuity as a kith'rak atop a red dragon.

LoveDryad_330.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_330.text: All we have seen, all that has changed, and you still cling to old crusades.

LoveDryad_386.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_386.text: I should know not to underestimate you. You see me with clear eyes and open mind.

LoveDryad_423.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_423.text: An illuminating exercise. You've listened, if not always with both ears in attendance.

LoveDryad_260.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_260.text: I suppose I should be grateful - you helped me shed any illusions that you've been paying attention.
LoveDryad_260.context: NodeContext: Acidic. The player failed every single 'how well do you know your lover' question at a carnival attraction

LoveDryad_591.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_591.text: Quite right. This is my fate, wrought by loyalty, entrusted to Vlaakith.

LoveDryad_366.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_366.text: She will be known as a liberator of the githyanki people.

LoveDryad_293.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_293.text: I will carry the truth to my people, whatever it might mean. Only time will tell how I'm remembered.

LoveDryad_343.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_343.text: Bah - my people already know liberty. Once, the illithids enslaved us; thanks to Vlaakith, we remain free.

LoveDryad_166.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_166.text: A vicious monster of legend, feared across the planes.

LoveDryad_127.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_127.text: I will be feared, this much is true. As a monster? No. As a champion? Most certainly.

LoveDryad_8.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_8.text: She will take Vlaakith's place as Queen of the githyanki.

LoveDryad_186.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_186.text: You confuse fiction for fact. Even at my most loyal, I never longed for the githyanki throne.

LoveDryad_544.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_544.text: Vlaakith is the githyanki. I would never deign take the place of my Queen!

LoveDryad_374.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_374.text: A small delight, indeed. I did not want their friendship - I wanted their fear.

LoveDryad_185.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_185.text: Chk. I don't see the harm.

LoveDryad_495.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_495.text: Not today. Or any other time, come to think of it.

LoveDryad_53.speaker: Lae'zel
LoveDryad_53.text: I'd sooner slice off both my hands and feed them to a rabid boar.

LoveDryad_41.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_41.text: This could be fun, Karlach. What do you think?

LoveDryad_413.speaker: Karlach
LoveDryad_413.text: Yes, yes, yes! Let's do it!

LoveDryad_95.speaker: Karlach
LoveDryad_95.text: Hah! Absolutely. This is gonna be great fun.

LoveDryad_59.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_59.text: Karlach: her fire within can incinerate an enemy or warm a beloved.

LoveDryad_75.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_75.text: Listen. Think. Who does she loathe above all others?

LoveDryad_471.speaker: Karlach
LoveDryad_471.text: She's the worst of the worst. I suppose a devil can't help her nature, but she's got a really godsdamn bad nature.

LoveDryad_568.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_568.text: Many things delight the heart, but only one makes it sing. Tell me, what is her idea of a perfect day?

LoveDryad_25.speaker: Karlach
LoveDryad_25.text: I'd rather have my horns yanked out with a tweezers. Come on, give me a little action.

LoveDryad_567.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_567.text: There is a hollowness between you, a void that your futures may come to fill with darkness.

LoveDryad_292.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_292.text: Bashing baddies interspersed with victory sex.

LoveDryad_585.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_585.text: Our touch has been that of sunlight. But now we must look beyond - to the uncertain. To the future.

LoveDryad_142.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_142.text: The sweetest loves dance lightly on the tongue. But they sag and suffer with age. The future brings many trials.

LoveDryad_271.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_271.text: A decade from now, what will the mighty Karlach do? Where will she be?

LoveDryad_554.speaker: Karlach
LoveDryad_554.text: Honestly - probably. But hopefully not any time soon. I've got a lot of living to do yet.

LoveDryad_225.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_225.text: Settled down in a quiet village with a nice partner and a few kids.

LoveDryad_303.speaker: Karlach
LoveDryad_303.text: Kids, huh? I don't know. How about a really mean goat.

LoveDryad_387.speaker: Karlach
LoveDryad_387.text: But... I don't know. Things can change I guess. I've heard.

LoveDryad_234.speaker: Karlach
LoveDryad_234.text: You really know me, don't you? It's wild. In so many ways, we barely know each other. But where it counts, you're deeper in my head than that tadpole.

LoveDryad_578.speaker: Karlach
LoveDryad_578.text: You did pretty well there, soldier. I have to say, I'm impressed.

LoveDryad_221.speaker: Karlach
LoveDryad_221.text: Well. I think we've proven here today that we really don't know each other very well, do we? Ah well. There's time.

LoveDryad_143.speaker: Karlach
LoveDryad_143.text: She's nice. But I'm more of a sunlight girl myself.

LoveDryad_586.speaker: Karlach
LoveDryad_586.text: Just the sound of his name makes my blood boil - probably literally. Can't stand the fucker. Ding ding.

LoveDryad_256.speaker: Karlach
LoveDryad_256.text: I'd be highly entertained if he choked on a button. But I don't hate him, per se.

LoveDryad_226.speaker: Karlach
LoveDryad_226.text: Excuse you! I think not. Not ever.
LoveDryad_226.context: NodeContext: Saying she would never hate the player, so with fondness

LoveDryad_415.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_415.text: The bond wavers, but we have only just begun. Have faith.

LoveDryad_120.speaker: Karlach
LoveDryad_120.text: Mmm, I don't think so. Seems a little... I don't know. Just no.

LoveDryad_340.speaker: Karlach
LoveDryad_340.text: With you? Please. That story's written in stone, and it ends with you on one side of the world and me on the other.

LoveDryad_267.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_267.text: Astarion, are you up for this?

LoveDryad_113.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_113.text: Oh my love, how could I say no?

LoveDryad_314.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_314.text: Astarion: a tumultuous past hides behind a mirthful grin.

LoveDryad_84.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_84.text: The heart is fraught, so let us begin with the joyous. When is he happiest?

LoveDryad_300.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_300.text: I don't think he's ever been happy.

LoveDryad_159.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_159.text: Excuse me? I've been happy, thank you very much.
LoveDryad_159.context: NodeContext: Response to "I don't think he's ever been happy"

LoveDryad_448.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_448.text: I'm not right now, but whose fault is that?
LoveDryad_448.context: NodeContext: "I'm not happy right now, but whose fault is that?"

LoveDryad_216.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_216.context: NodeContext: responding to "he's happiest when he's killing people"

LoveDryad_539.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_539.text: Many things delight the heart, but only one makes it sing. Tell me, what does he desire more than anything?

LoveDryad_570.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_570.text: Oh you're very sweet. I wouldn't say no to some gory vengeance personally, but that was an adorable answer.

LoveDryad_368.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_368.text: You're not wrong, but do we need to tell every stranger we meet our business?

LoveDryad_547.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_547.text: Fear sits in the soul of all - to tame it, we must name it. Astarion - what is his deepest fear?

LoveDryad_347.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_347.text: You're very funny, did I ever mention that?
LoveDryad_347.context: NodeContext: Not impressed with the attempt at a joke

LoveDryad_50.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_50.text: Ha! Well, when you look this good...

LoveDryad_532.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_532.text: Well... You were right every time. I almost wish you hadn't been, but you do know me...

LoveDryad_446.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_446.text: I have to say, you know me better than I thought. I'll have to be more mysterious in future.

LoveDryad_392.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_392.text: Well, that was a disaster. Can we call time on this farce? Please?

LoveDryad_332.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_332.text: Forever feeling like a slave to someone else.

LoveDryad_135.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_135.text: Really? I mean, yes, but - really? You'd tell whatever stranger just walked up and asked?

LoveDryad_68.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_68.text: That which needs to be said is often the most difficult. Take pride - you are one step closer to conquering your fears.

LoveDryad_528.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_528.text: There is no need for secrecy here. You wear your truth so close to the skin.

LoveDryad_91.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_91.text: Oh I like that answer. Yes, let's go with that.

LoveDryad_280.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_280.text: I cannot, little one. I can accept truth, and only truth - and you know that is not what lies within your hearts.

LoveDryad_11.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_11.text: You betray yourselves. A bond based on lies will one day be severed.

LoveDryad_35.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_35.context: NodeContext: Response to "more than anything he wants revenge"

LoveDryad_512.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_512.text: Urgh, really? Of all the things you could think of - that?

LoveDryad_45.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_45.text: He's happy right now - look at that smile!

LoveDryad_396.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_396.text: It's a grimace, sweetie. Not off to a great start.

LoveDryad_240.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_240.text: Oh I'm the one you love? Well my dear, how could I say no?

LoveDryad_265.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_265.text: A sweet gesture, but all... this? It's not really for me.
LoveDryad_265.context: NodeContext: refusing to take a 'love test' from a dryad

LoveDryad_409.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_409.text: Wait, I'm the one you love? Oh no - oh that's so sad.
LoveDryad_409.context: NodeContext: shocked, laughing - someone he didn't like just asked Astarion to take a love test with them

LoveDryad_331.speaker: Astarion
LoveDryad_331.text: But no, there's absolutely no way this is happening.
LoveDryad_331.context: NodeContext: amused, but emphatically refusing to take a 'love test' from a dryad

LoveDryad_190.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_190.text: This sounds like fun, Wyll. Want to try?

LoveDryad_258.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_258.text: I'm more than game. Let's do it.

LoveDryad_189.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_189.text: Why not? Could be good for a laugh.

LoveDryad_372.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_372.text: Wyll: the courageous heart tormented by the infernal.

LoveDryad_173.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_173.text: Listen. Think. What, on his darkest day, would make him smile?

LoveDryad_424.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_424.text: Memories of our first night getting to know each other.

LoveDryad_590.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_590.text: Indeed. You were a source of light among shadows. Still are, for that matter.

LoveDryad_184.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_184.text: We cannot live this life without others - others to guide us. To aspire to. Who does the Blade most admire?

LoveDryad_327.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_327.text: Hells. Have I fallen so far from your favour?

LoveDryad_286.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_286.text: Hardly. Astonishing that you'd even utter her name.

LoveDryad_458.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_458.text: Indeed. We've not always seen eye to eye, but his every thought, every act, was in service to his people. Among men, there is none greater.

LoveDryad_333.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_333.text: May he be at peace. We did not see eye to eye, but his every thought, every act, was in service to his people. Among men, there was none greater.

LoveDryad_416.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_416.text: Life is a difficult and tumultuous thing. With every smile, a tear often follows. What is Wyll's greatest regret?

LoveDryad_23.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_23.text: Her face still haunts me. If I could make the sun rise in the west, reverse the Chionthar's waters, I'd spare her my folly.

LoveDryad_382.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_382.text: You know me, you understand me. And for that, I'm forever grateful.

LoveDryad_115.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_115.text: This was good fun! You know me fairly well, it turns out.

LoveDryad_515.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_515.text: Together we've shed blood, shared words. Yet you've learned so little.

LoveDryad_94.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_94.text: Sparing Karlach and becoming a devil.

LoveDryad_531.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_531.text: No - we acted justly. That Karlach still lives is a delight worth celebrating, not lamenting.

LoveDryad_431.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_431.text: The Hells threatened to swallow the city. I made the only choice I could.

LoveDryad_174.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_174.text: Truly spoken. All he'd done for Baldur's Gate, for its people... He earned a better fate than the one Gortash gave him.

LoveDryad_376.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_376.text: Leaving behind his father - and his city.

LoveDryad_6.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_6.text: He gave me no choice. But it's true. I often wonder - what if I'd said the right words, made the right promises?

LoveDryad_411.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_411.text: Maybe I'd have been with him on the journey from Elturel. Maybe there'd be no Absolute, no infections, no... this.

LoveDryad_398.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_398.text: It pains me to hear you say it. We shared a bond, or so I thought. Does it mean nothing to you?

LoveDryad_319.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_319.text: Balduran, the great hero of Baldur's Gate.

LoveDryad_140.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_140.text: Yes - a hero in all senses. A courageous explorer and a just spirit. A pity to see what's become of him.

LoveDryad_406.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_406.text: Yes - a hero in all senses. A courageous explorer and a just spirit. Would that we all aspired to his greatness.

LoveDryad_316.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_316.text: A mug of nutty darndarr and a plate of cured meats? It's no Mount Celestia - but it's close.

LoveDryad_112.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_112.text: You'd have been right, not so long ago. But things have changed - a different time, a different Blade.

LoveDryad_564.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_564.text: The day he made his pact.

LoveDryad_379.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_379.text: A necessary step for my city's future. The Hells' fires ran red hot that day; I don't remember it fondly.

LoveDryad_32.speaker: Wyll
LoveDryad_32.text: I don't think so. But I appreciate the offer.

LoveDryad_165.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_165.text: Well, Minsc - what say we give it a go?

LoveDryad_245.speaker: Minsc
LoveDryad_245.text: Minsc is flattered, but surely you must know that his heart is already of the hamster shape. And twice as fuzzy.
LoveDryad_245.context: NodeContext: Player has just propositioned Minsc to have their prospects as lovers estimated by a dryad - tone is affectionate

LoveDryad_72.speaker: Minsc
LoveDryad_72.text: ...Boo? Does our friend know another Minsc? One that they might be courting, perhaps?
LoveDryad_72.context: NodeContext: Player has just propositioned Minsc to have their prospects as lovers estimated by a dryad - tone is dumbfounded, a stage whisper to Boo

LoveDryad_276.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_276.text: Jaheira, this could be entertaining - let's give it a go.

LoveDryad_430.speaker: Jaheira
LoveDryad_430.text: I'm flattered, but pick another. Watching the dryad make you cry will be entertainment enough.

LoveDryad_78.speaker: Jaheira
LoveDryad_78.text: Hm? Oh, the dryad is comely enough - but you? Don't poke at questions you don't want the answer to, cub.

LoveDryad_92.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_92.text: Sounds magical - what say you, Gale?

LoveDryad_122.speaker: Gale
LoveDryad_122.text: Thoroughly magical. Let's have at it.

LoveDryad_593.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_593.text: Gale: the learned wizard. The charming gentleman. The walking apocalypse.

LoveDryad_395.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_395.text: Listen. Think. If the wizard were given the choice, what food would he be?

LoveDryad_461.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_461.text: A lemon meringue - tart and lightweight.

LoveDryad_118.speaker: Gale
LoveDryad_118.text: Do you think so little of me? At least you didn't compare me to a spotted dick...
LoveDryad_118.context: InternalNodeContext: for loca - spotted dick = pudding type dessert

LoveDryad_133.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_133.text: The heart is fraught, so let us turn to the joyous. When is Gale happiest?

LoveDryad_596.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_596.text: At dusk. The light favours his complexion.

LoveDryad_427.speaker: Gale
LoveDryad_427.text: You make me sound like some preening peacock. I am not that bad.
LoveDryad_427.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed and offended

LoveDryad_378.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_378.text: While on his balcony in Waterdeep.

LoveDryad_403.speaker: Gale
LoveDryad_403.text: Bravo. That is indeed where my mind wanders to, when times are hard...

LoveDryad_353.speaker: Gale
LoveDryad_353.text: Once, perhaps. But those passions have soured.

LoveDryad_526.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_526.text: We often gaze through a veil of roses, but love accepts both the petal and the thorn. Gale - what is his greatest flaw?

LoveDryad_450.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_450.text: He's too enraptured by illusions and fantasies, neglecting what's real.

LoveDryad_27.speaker: Gale
LoveDryad_27.text: I have worse failings, I fear. Far worse.

LoveDryad_491.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_491.text: He's too eager to please, no matter the cost.

LoveDryad_214.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_214.text: He thinks he, and the world, might be better off if he were dead.

LoveDryad_555.speaker: Gale
LoveDryad_555.text: Hearing it said out loud - yes, I fear it is true. Fate seems determined to make a sacrifice of me.

LoveDryad_338.speaker: Gale
LoveDryad_338.text: But perhaps fate can yet be defied...

LoveDryad_574.speaker: Gale
LoveDryad_574.text: A perfect score. It seems you know me better than I know myself.

LoveDryad_412.speaker: Gale
LoveDryad_412.text: It seems you've been paying attention to me - though there is always room for improvement.

LoveDryad_58.speaker: Gale
LoveDryad_58.text: I've had a little stone caught in my boot the last while - clearly that makes for a better travelling companion than you do.

LoveDryad_485.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_485.text: A shiny red apple - wholesome as can be.

LoveDryad_151.speaker: Gale
LoveDryad_151.text: Ah, the fruit of scholars. How I long to have a troop of loyal students grace me with apples by the orchard-full in exchange for wisdoms imparted...

LoveDryad_134.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_134.text: A three-day-old pot of tavern stew - muddled and questionable.

LoveDryad_551.speaker: Gale
LoveDryad_551.text: I'm not opposed to a bowl of something mysterious and rib-sticking, but I certainly don't identify as one.

LoveDryad_211.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_211.text: A roast onion - versatile, with hidden layers.

LoveDryad_513.speaker: Gale
LoveDryad_513.text: An apt metaphor - though I hope it won't lose me some kisses.

LoveDryad_367.speaker: Gale
LoveDryad_367.text: Perhaps you're overestimating my affection towards you a tad? You'd better seek a partner-in-embarrassment elsewhere.

LoveDryad_592.speaker: Gale
LoveDryad_592.text: No thank you. Sounds as appealing as milking cottage cheese directly from a geriatric cow.

LoveDryad_139.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_139.text: Minthara, my dear, shall we show this dryad how it's done?

LoveDryad_213.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_213.text: I know my heart - and yours - better than this creature ever will. But we can indulge it if you wish.

LoveDryad_164.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_164.text: Fine. But if this creature can truly look into my heart, it best be careful what it reveals.

LoveDryad_464.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_464.text: Minthara: a mask of ice hides a heart of pure fire - you do well to call her close.

LoveDryad_2.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_2.text: Listen. Think. What does the drow miss most about the Underdark?

LoveDryad_169.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_169.text: Picking off her siblings one by one.

LoveDryad_209.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_209.text: Not just siblings. Androcide, senicide, avunculicide - I only regret I left before enjoying a matricide. That would be a memory to cherish.

LoveDryad_131.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_131.text: Many pass through our lives, their touch rippling across time. But who does Minthara admire the most?

LoveDryad_420.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_420.text: Please. I'd rather spend my nights with a drider than with that do-gooder and his pussycat.

LoveDryad_550.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_550.text: If I admired nobody I would travel alone. You have earned my admiration. And more.

LoveDryad_220.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_220.text: Presumptious. But not inaccurate. You have earned my companionship - that is no easy task.

LoveDryad_429.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_429.text: I think not. The gods are more fickle than the fools who follow them.

LoveDryad_536.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_536.text: Those with an icy façade hide their true selves well - but pain breaks us all in the end. What is the worst thing your love has ever done?

LoveDryad_445.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_445.text: Slaughtering the tieflings at the grove.

LoveDryad_144.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_144.text: I barely remember the grove... I was not myself. But my only regret is that I exerted myself in the name of a false god.

LoveDryad_381.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_381.text: Let herself be captured by the cult of the Absolute.

LoveDryad_83.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_83.text: I do not know what weakness of mine allowed them to take me.

LoveDryad_18.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_18.text: That haunts me more than anything they did to me.

LoveDryad_121.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_121.text: You know my heart, and I am glad. You are the first.

LoveDryad_208.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_208.text: Are we finished? You were only mildly disappointing. Well done.

LoveDryad_269.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_269.text: I had always kept my heart hidden, but I allowed you to see it. To see me. It saddens me that you saw a stranger instead.

LoveDryad_489.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_489.text: Without Lolth or the Absolute, I am free for the first time. Some may call it exile, I call it independence.

LoveDryad_394.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_394.text: Self-deprecation is not endearing. It is demeaning.

LoveDryad_188.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_188.text: Spiders are Lolth's creatures - as was I. Her cult controlled me just as the Absolute did. Not a pleasant memory at all.

LoveDryad_289.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_289.text: Spending time with her beloved family.

LoveDryad_177.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_177.text: There was no love to be found. My mother would have poisoned her own milk to torment me.

LoveDryad_136.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_136.text: Spiced Ulaver wine and thinly sliced rothé steak.

LoveDryad_287.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_287.text: It is true. Surface food lacks flavour. House Baenre banquets were legendary.

LoveDryad_85.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_85.text: The creature need not look into our hearts to see that I barely tolerate your existence.

LoveDryad_582.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LoveDryad_582.text: No. And if you refer to me as 'my dear' again, I will cut out your tongue.

LoveDryad_80.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_80.text: What do you think, Halsin? Shall we put ourselves to the test?

LoveDryad_20.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_20.text: Gladly. We each know the other's heart to the fullest - there is little to fear here.

LoveDryad_130.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_130.text: Halsin: nature's gentle steward - and furious defender.

LoveDryad_597.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_597.text: Listen. Think. When is he most comfortable?

LoveDryad_498.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_498.text: While in the form of a bear, clad in nothing but fur.

LoveDryad_577.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_577.text: A fair assumption. Perhaps not the truest answer of all, but still in good judgement.

LoveDryad_315.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_315.text: We strive to do our utmost - to prove ourselves worthy. Tell me - of what is Halsin most proud?

LoveDryad_66.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_66.text: His physique. Who can blame him?

LoveDryad_268.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_268.text: No, that is not right. My body is but a vessel to serve nature with. To take pride in it is to indulge in vanity.

LoveDryad_479.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_479.text: Life is full of victory and loss. You cannot have one without the other. Halsin - what is his greatest failure?

LoveDryad_100.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_100.text: Appointing a fanatic as his second-in-command at the grove.

LoveDryad_7.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_7.text: Perhaps not my greatest failure, but a sizeable one, yes. My faith in Kagha showed... poor judgement, put mildly. Very mildly.

LoveDryad_227.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_227.text: Allowing the shadow curse to blight nature for a hundred years.

LoveDryad_14.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_14.text: It is true. Nature suffered, while I dawdled, and allowed myself to be distracted.

LoveDryad_521.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_521.text: The curse is no more, true. But imagine if I had been faster, bolder, better. Lives would have been saved. More than I care to count.

LoveDryad_141.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_141.text: But I must move on. Nature demands that I do.

LoveDryad_469.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_469.text: I had high expectations, but even still, I am impressed. You may know me better than I know myself.

LoveDryad_228.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_228.text: You understand me almost perfectly. Only my late mother may have bested you.

LoveDryad_484.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_484.text: An... unfortunate result. Perhaps we should not have partaken.

LoveDryad_33.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_33.text: That he somehow let some scrawny goblins capture him.

LoveDryad_523.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_523.text: No... that wasn't my most glorious moment, but my greatest failure? Far from it.

LoveDryad_124.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_124.text: No, you are mistaken. Rejecting unwanted advances is no failure, even if it earned me some scars.
LoveDryad_124.context: NodeContext: A little scolding and disappointed

LoveDryad_49.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_49.text: Saving his friend Thaniel and banishing the shadow curse.

LoveDryad_62.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_62.text: This is the truth. I sense I will never surpass that moment, when nature awoke from its nightmare.

LoveDryad_152.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_152.text: Pleasant, vivid memories, yes. But my greatest source of pride? No.

LoveDryad_356.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_356.text: Protecting his grove from those who threatened it.

LoveDryad_598.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_598.text: A source of pride, true. I can think of greater feats, but that one is cherished all the same.

LoveDryad_542.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_542.text: After a supper large enough to induce hibernation.

LoveDryad_199.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_199.text: Mindless gorging...? No, that is not right. I did not realise you thought that of me.

LoveDryad_36.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_36.text: Comfort doesn't come naturally to him - he's restless and roaming.

LoveDryad_272.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_272.text: This is the truth - I live for the wilderness. Comfort is for the farm animal, snug in its pen.

LoveDryad_195.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_195.text: At his study in the grove.

LoveDryad_443.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_443.text: Scholarly pursuits are important... but my heart lies elsewhere.

LoveDryad_31.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_31.text: I thought you may have bestowed the honour on someone else. But if this is what you wish, so be it.

LoveDryad_202.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_202.text: I suppose we've braved greater dangers together than public embarrassment. Do as you wish.

LoveDryad_572.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_572.text: You flatter me... but also overestimate our bond, I think. Perhaps there is another you can turn to.

LoveDryad_524.speaker: Halsin
LoveDryad_524.text: Nature is my true love. You, I merely tolerate.

LoveDryad_296.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_296.text: I have someone in mind - let me go get them.

LoveDryad_579.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_579.text: I await with a heart full and happy - eager to begin.

LoveDryad_575.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_575.text: Like I need a dryad to tell me what I feel.

LoveDryad_389.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_389.text: Your words are cruel, but your heart quivers. Love is a tangled forest - there is no shame in seeking guidance. Think on it.

LoveDryad_176.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_176.text: I have no time for love.

LoveDryad_360.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_360.text: Love blossoms in life's furies - you have formed bonds in this time, have you not? Trust. Respect. These are clothes that love dresses in.

LoveDryad_158.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_158.text: Everyone loves - even those who wrap their hearts in stone. I can help you see that love more clearly.

LoveDryad_560.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_560.text: You return, stira - good. Violence is like fire - it burns all those in its path. I feared you caught in the flames.

LoveDryad_459.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_459.text: Do you wish to speak of love, little one? For Zethino is here to help - always. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

LoveDryad_563.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_563.text: This city of stone and steel is an endless scream in nature's womb. I have felt no peace here. Until now.

LoveDryad_581.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_581.text: You return, stira. I pray the hearts of you and your companion are ready - for love is a fragile blossom, and we will test its resilience. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

LoveDryad_477.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_477.text: Why do you keep calling me 'stira'?

LoveDryad_400.speaker: Zethino
LoveDryad_400.text: Forgive me - I had not realised. My beloved, before she died, was a woman of great strength and fortitude. I called her stira in our quiet moments.

LoveDryad_24.speaker: Player
LoveDryad_24.text: What do you say, Shadowheart? Do you want to try this?

Beast_01_22.speaker: Shadow-Whiskers
Beast_01_22.text: My kills. My prey. You took them. Run. I'll find you. Eat you. COWARD.

Beast_01_34.speaker: Narrator
Beast_01_34.text: *Teeth bared, she promises claws in your gut, and fangs on your throat.*

Beast_01_43.speaker: Shadow-Whiskers
Beast_01_43.text: I thought you a hunter. Wrong. You're prey - small. Snivelling. Pathetic.

Beast_01_63.speaker: Player
Beast_01_63.text: Check if the cage's lock is secure.

Beast_01_23.speaker: Narrator
Beast_01_23.text: *While the cage is sturdy, the lock is old. It could be jammed shut - so not even a key could open it.*
Beast_01_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player inspect the cage. Reusing animation.

Beast_01_45.speaker: Narrator
Beast_01_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player inspect the cage. Reusing animation.

Beast_01_39.speaker: Shadow-Whiskers
Beast_01_39.text: My time comes. I will show you. All of you.

Beast_01_31.speaker: Player
Beast_01_31.text: Show me what? Come on - your secret is safe with me.

Beast_01_32.speaker: Shadow-Whiskers
Beast_01_32.text: Mock me. Tease me. You will be the first.

Beast_01_26.speaker: Player
Beast_01_26.text: First in what? Come on - your secret is safe with me.

Beast_01_3.speaker: Shadow-Whiskers
Beast_01_3.text: Look. See. The crowd - they laugh. They shine with innocence. But it is a lie.

Beast_01_64.speaker: Shadow-Whiskers
Beast_01_64.text: Every one of you is vicious. Cruel. You kill my mate. Steal my cubs.

Beast_01_44.speaker: Halsin
Beast_01_44.text: Poor creature - locked in a cage, denied her true nature. Civilisation would call her a monstrosity, yet it treats her like this...?
Beast_01_44.context: NodeContext: Saddened/outraged at a caged creature's plight

Beast_01_53.speaker: Shadow-Whiskers
Beast_01_53.text: I roar. Break my cage - and then you die. You all die.

Beast_01_30.speaker: Player
Beast_01_30.text: Break the lock, ensuring the cage can't be opened.

Beast_01_61.speaker: Shadow-Whiskers
Beast_01_61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Give a punch to the cage. Reuse.

Beast_01_27.speaker: Player
Beast_01_27.text: When exactly do you plan on killing everyone?

Beast_01_60.speaker: Player
Beast_01_60.text: Murder whoever you want. I'll be long gone.

Beast_01_68.speaker: Player
Beast_01_68.text: Tell me what you're up to or I set this cage on fire.

Beast_01_20.speaker: Narrator
Beast_01_20.text: *The beast ignores you, her eyes locked on the crowd.*
Beast_01_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: the beast is NOT looking at player, she's looking away in the direction of the crowd

Beast_01_52.speaker: Player
Beast_01_52.text: Make a noise, trying to catch her attention.

Beast_01_54.speaker: Narrator
Beast_01_54.text: *You see a tidal wave of hate and violence in her eyes, before she turns away.*
Beast_01_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to look at player, then turns back to the crowd. Player claps hands or make a noise. Reusing animation.

Beast_01_66.speaker: Narrator
Beast_01_66.text: *She will attack, and kill, at the first opportunity.*

Beast_01_37.speaker: Player
Beast_01_37.text: Break the lock, trapping the beast within.

Beast_01_75.speaker: Narrator
Beast_01_75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Give a punch to the cage. Reuse.

Checkpoint_21.speaker: Klaus
Checkpoint_21.text: Now, now - you didn't pass the sniff test. Which means no circus for you - off you go!
Checkpoint_21.context: NodeContext: Dismissive shooing gesture - like to a dog. (player isn't allowed into the circus)

Checkpoint_61.speaker: Karlach
Checkpoint_61.text: Ah! A circus! Can we go?!
Checkpoint_61.context: NodeContext: First 'Ah' is meant to be a childlike gasp of excitement. Think bouncing on her toes with enthusiasm to go inside.

Checkpoint_74.speaker: Benji
Checkpoint_74.text: *Sniff.* STINKS of CHEESE. *Sniff.* Between his PIGGY TOES.

Checkpoint_88.speaker: Montgomery
Checkpoint_88.text: How dare you! What in the hells is all of this?

Checkpoint_125.speaker: Klaus
Checkpoint_125.text: A necessity, good sir! The Steel Watch loves pretending sweet Rivington doesn't exist.
Checkpoint_125.context: NodeContext: cheerful - used to handling difficult customers.

Checkpoint_17.speaker: Klaus
Checkpoint_17.text: So we have decided to protect you, dear patrons. No need to thank us. You'll be allowed in once I've done this batch - next!
Checkpoint_17.context: NodeContext: diverting customers outrage lie a pro. Cheerful.

Checkpoint_71.speaker: Klaus
Checkpoint_71.text: Hello, hello, and welcome to the Circus of the Last Days - the finest extraplanar circus there is!

Checkpoint_81.speaker: Karlach
Checkpoint_81.text: Ah! A circus! Can we go?!
Checkpoint_81.context: NodeContext: First 'Ah' is meant to be a childlike gasp of excitement. Think bouncing on her toes with enthusiasm to go inside.

Checkpoint_3.speaker: Narrator
Checkpoint_3.text: *This entire place practically vibrates with a familiar, excitable magic. You feel your patron giggle from afar - it's fey magic.*

Checkpoint_99.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_99.text: I've never heard of an 'extraplanar circus'.

Checkpoint_47.speaker: Klaus
Checkpoint_47.text: We travel from plane to plane, thrilling all blessed to see us! From tempestuous djinni to belligerent redcaps - you'll find them all here.
Checkpoint_47.context: NodeContext: this is a sales pitch but he's also CLEARLY really proud to be part of the circus

Checkpoint_76.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_76.text: Why is a ghoul sniffing people?

Checkpoint_52.speaker: Klaus
Checkpoint_52.text: Oh, this is Benjamin! Say hi, Benji.

Checkpoint_56.speaker: Klaus
Checkpoint_56.text: Benji here checks all our patrons to make sure none of you are vicious murderers. Can't be too careful!

Checkpoint_12.speaker: Klaus
Checkpoint_12.text: But enough of this - the circus is a place of joy and distraction! So come inside and forget your worries.

Checkpoint_24.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_24.text: All right - I'd like to enter the circus.

Checkpoint_75.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_75.text: I'm not a murderer, I swear on the graves of my Father's sacrificial victims!

Checkpoint_15.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_15.text: Is this extra security because of the priest who was murdered?

Checkpoint_41.speaker: Klaus
Checkpoint_41.text: Oh, more than him got the knife. They say the Absolute's cronies have been busy chopping people up like it's going out of style.
Checkpoint_41.context: NodeContext: sharing gossip, but not horrified knows he's protected)

Checkpoint_94.speaker: Klaus
